content:
Posted: March 7, 2016
												Guns of Icarus Review (Level 18, 68h) :+ Pros- Unique game in its genre. Play as a crew in a steampunk ship ! Be either the captain, the gunner, or one of the two engineers. - Graphics are very good, although a bit dated. The art direction is magnificient, it's a pleasure to fly through the different environment.- Combat is really well done, although you need to get some knowledge on how it works to fully understands it. Spend time to experiment etc.- Usually good community.- Good price for what it is- A freaking lot of achievements for those who want to grab them all !- The cash shop is purely cosmetical, and it allows to customise your character (a lot) and your ship (very little).- Negatives-You need friends and a voice communication to get a good experience. Playing alone or without voice com will make you bored, frustrated and angry.- Not much content. 5 ships, a good variety of weapons, but you're quickly going to get through everything. However mastering them takes skill and time, and of course a good crew.- PVP only so far, so brace yourself. Alliance DLC is coming soon though with PVE and more content.- Small but dedicated playerbase. You have to learn quickly or you'll get stomped by veterans.Overall : 9/10 with a full 4 player crew,  5/10 without. The game offers an unique and incredibly fun experience if you can get 3 of your friends on it. If not, then you'll quickly lose interest in it, as you can not put advanced strategies and likely get stomped in loop. The Alliance DLC might be a life changer though, as a PVE experience could bring a lot of new players and be quite enjoyable even withotu a full crew on vocals. We'll see !Final verdict : Excellent game, for casuals or pros alike, provided you have 3 or more friends with you.

content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
												One of the best of competitive multiplayer genre and at the same time most underrated game I know. If you're one of those types who always wanted to feel like, let's say, Admiral Horatio Nelson and sail their own ship (or fly, in this case), or command a fleet, THIS GAME WAS MADE FOR YOU. The gameplay promotes teamwork among the crewmates and the other pilots of your team. The team tactics are interesting aspect of the game. There are numerous ships, tools, weapons and ammunition, each useful in different kind of situations. The combat itself: Long-range, close-range, ramming, stomping etc. - all in three-dimensions and that's awesome. The most you can get out of this game is if you play with friends and form a crew or a fleet, but if your peers prefer different genres like mine, it's still a great game to play as pilot solo.Absolutely recommend!

content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												The concept of this game is great. You fly around and have airship dogfights, and you can use all your sailing terminology like you know what it all means!The tutorial went thru pretty quick, so I'd recommend taking the time to play them twice and review the controls.Matchmaking never takes more than a few minutes to find a match, and empty crew slots are filled with AI. From what I've seen, AI can be lacking and you'll wish you want a real player. Until you get matched with someone who doesn't know what's going on... then you'll want your AI back. If someone leaves, AI take their place which is a huge plus in these kind of games as you aren't left shorthanded.There is a bit of a learning curve, but leveling is slow which gives you the time to get on page with everything. Once you reach level 8 you are no longer restricted to novice matches.I have not yet reached level 8, so I have limited customization of ships and characters. But it seems you can modify anything from your ship guns down to your character's voice.Playing solo is not a hinderance, you can ingame text and voice chat to your crew, team, or captains. But if you have a group of friends who are looking for a game to play.. Look No Further!9.5/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2015
												Probably one the best games that I have ever played. And I'm not putting that lightly.Pros:+ Decent graphics+ Cool idea+ Good class balance+ No pay to win (only cosmetics)+ Loads of teamwork involved+ Lots of awesome artwork/designs for ships and clothing+ Matchmaking is good+ Not too bad of a price+ Gets really intense and can leave you feeling like you actually were there, fighting alongside your friends+ Tutorial is easy and explanatory+ Tons and tons and tons of customization. Literally anything you could think ofCons:- Not well optimised. With my mid-high end custom-built desktop, I run at a solid 60fps until I get into a fight with explosions of any kind, which can sometimes drop my frames to a mere 20-30fps- Not all the ships are perfectly balanced. There aren't any ships that are overpowered, though some of the ships are never used simply because they aren't as balanced as the others- Leveling up doesn't have that many rewards- Not a lot of maps, though you rarely notice your surroundings unless you're a pilot or there's no fighting going onOther Ideas:~ If you are playing with a group of 4 friends, this game is, well, simply awesome. However, if you find yourself with any less than 4 of your friends, you can sometimes end up with a newbie crewmate~ The game doesn't REQUIRE a microphone, though it seems nearly pointless without one. Without the ability to communicate with your crew/party with live voice chat, trying to say things like "THE BALLOON IS ON FIRE" can only be said with the (somewhat hard to navigate) built-in voice chat (think TF2 voice commands)

content:
Posted: May 22, 2014
												Had this game for a while but never bothered actually playing an online game until just recently. That said, I'm not sure how this game used to fare back then but it seems to have come a long way. I would go as far as saying it's one of the better games that requires some actual team effort. With your crew depending on an able Captain and or Pilot to steer them in the right direction and vice versa to keep the ship flying and fight back whilst under enemy fire.Some may say the different roles by themselves lack a bit of depth but I think their straightforward playstyle makes it more approachable to newcomers, and I'm doubtful if making it any more complicated would better the game. Furthermore difficulty comes with the ship you'll be flying on which depends on your crew Captain's choice and is open to customization at his/her will as they can be armed with different weapons to specialize in long and/or short range, and each ship has different stats and difficulty in management.As with many games based on teamwork, voice communication is a plus but like I said; because of how direct the roles are, a crew with a bit of commons sense would fare just fine without or by using the in-game commands / text messaging. On contrary to popular belief, the AI isn't as bad as one would think.. people write them off so easily because they are unaware of the existence of orders which if given properly and timely, make the AI a formidable crew not to take lightly. This is however my experience and may be subject to change on higher levels / advanced ships though I highly doubt it unless there's some kind of pathfinding issues.The game has been on sale many times before and packs quite some value at that because in it's current state I do think it's worth the normal pricetag. If you like being part of a crew on an air ship and conquer the skies alongside others in a setting a la steampunk this game is as close as you can get. The feeling of seeing your ship and or crew unleashing hell on your foes and landing those hits is exhilarating to say the least.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2016
												Guns of Icarus Review (Level 18, 68h) :+ Pros- Unique game in its genre. Play as a crew in a steampunk ship ! Be either the captain, the gunner, or one of the two engineers. - Graphics are very good, although a bit dated. The art direction is magnificient, it's a pleasure to fly through the different environment.- Combat is really well done, although you need to get some knowledge on how it works to fully understands it. Spend time to experiment etc.- Usually good community.- Good price for what it is- A freaking lot of achievements for those who want to grab them all !- The cash shop is purely cosmetical, and it allows to customise your character (a lot) and your ship (very little).- Negatives-You need friends and a voice communication to get a good experience. Playing alone or without voice com will make you bored, frustrated and angry.- Not much content. 5 ships, a good variety of weapons, but you're quickly going to get through everything. However mastering them takes skill and time, and of course a good crew.- PVP only so far, so brace yourself. Alliance DLC is coming soon though with PVE and more content.- Small but dedicated playerbase. You have to learn quickly or you'll get stomped by veterans.Overall : 9/10 with a full 4 player crew,  5/10 without. The game offers an unique and incredibly fun experience if you can get 3 of your friends on it. If not, then you'll quickly lose interest in it, as you can not put advanced strategies and likely get stomped in loop. The Alliance DLC might be a life changer though, as a PVE experience could bring a lot of new players and be quite enjoyable even withotu a full crew on vocals. We'll see !Final verdict : Excellent game, for casuals or pros alike, provided you have 3 or more friends with you.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2014
												I wouldn't consider this game an action oriented game by any means, it's a strategy game. Everyone starts off with the same equipment, but you can customize your ship or your character to match your crew(always work in a 4 man group). There is no such thing as going lone wolf in this game. Each ship has 4 people on it, one controls it/gives orders,  and the rest maintain the ship and shoot other ships, which can be good or bad thing depending on your teammates/captain. There are three roles you get on this game: Engineer- Your main focus is repair, you are what keeps the ship going. Most of this play style is based on time management and focus; the difficulty of this class is based on the ship you're on. Sometimes you'll have an easy time maintaining the ship  and shooting guns when you have the chance, othertimes your focus will fully be on repairs. Since engineers are the ones who get around the ship the most, it's also handy to keep an eye out for enemy ships coming from the captain's blindspotsGunner- uses the guns, but mostly manages the rounds in that gun.The rounds you pick before the match begins are important, they decide the effect the gun has on your gun/enemy ship. Sometimes with this class you might need to make an emergency repair, but most of the time you're maintaining your gun and firing on the enemy ship. Each gun also affects different parts of the enemy ship in different ways, so play around until you understand what gun works best on what you're aiming at.Captain- As a captain, you organize your ship and your crew before the match begins, and then pilot the ship in game. You're the person in charge on your ship, and you work together with the other captain to decide how to attack or defend against the enemy ship. Communication as a captain is very important, along with strategy and picking your fights. A good knowledge of how the guns work and how your ship gets repaired can help in deciding what you can do with that ship.I would recommend this game if you like strategy and teamwork over brute force. The community is a close knit one where everyone knows everyone else practically, and is very open to helping new players along, so feel free to ask questions to higher level players or hop on ships and ask what they want you to bring/do. Just be patient, and have fun with it.

content:
Posted: October 17, 2015
												This is a game about teamwork, communication, and tactical thinking. Between the interactions between crew members to keep a ship moving smoothly, the interactions between captains to coordinate attacks, and the spatial considerations in maneuvering in a 3D air environment to avoid taking hits while positioning yourself to dish out damage, this games offers some of the best gameplay available to take a group of people and forge them into a friendly fighting unit.Whether you have a group of friends looking to play together, or you are joining alone, if you are willing to open to fellow players, Guns of Icarus offers a unique opportunity to bond with local and distant gamers over the common goal of keeping an airship in the air.I highly recommend trying this game. If you find you enjoy the gameplay, I encourage you to look towards the forums and the clans. The depth of the strategy of the game is staggering even with the limited number of ship styles and guns.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 6, 2016
												I have played Guns of Icarus for 16 hours at the time of writing, but I know all that I need to to write this review, and hopefully help any new players thinking of getting the game themselves. First and last, there is an almost necessary yet unspoken social contract in guns of Icarus which you are almost required to follow.First: you must make an effort to learn the game. If you think that Guns can be played like any lone-wolf solo game, you will be ostracized until you get serious. Observe what others do, and follow suit until you get it, so that you drag others down as little as possible. There's a lot you won't get at first.Second: the captain can be contested, but follow his orders anyways. Captains can be (and often are) wrong, but they usually know the most about game flow. Respect their decisions, but don't be afraid to say that they are incorrect if you have a good reason.Third: know the crew before you try and captain. If you haven't played gunner or engineer for at least three rounds each, don't bother being a captain. You probably don't know enough to be good at it yet, that's just a fact.Fourth: your class roles are important, but not set in stone. Gunners have an extra repair tool, and engineers have an extra ammo type for a reason. Just beacuse you are one class doesn't mean you can't play as another (just that you probably shouldn't).Fifth and final: be a sportsman. Respect your enemies, and respect your allies. If you aren't willing to do your best, don't bother. It really shows when someone doesn't care, and everyone can see it.If you can do all those things, Guns will gladly let you into the ranks of its own. The pros will be able to help you and answer your questions, and in a few short hours of these you'll be pretty good too. Guns is daunting at first, but it's simple once you get it. Keep trying your best, and you'll be great at it in almost no time.

The leveling system doesn't give anyone an advantage. Levels show that you know what you are doing and give people an idea of your overall skill level.  The game also isn't pay to win.  What you can pay for is cosmetic enhancements. Overall, GoIO has given me several hours of fun gameplay with my friends.  If you like co-op games based on team skill, then definitely buy this game. The devs put alot of effort into this game.  They even play and give free rewards if you can beat them.  They are still improving this game.  Even now, there groundworks for an adventure mode, based on the wreckages you can see in the battle maps that suggest a cataclysmic war of some kind.Edit:Adventure Mode!!!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 4, 2015
												GoIO is a multiplayer game like no other. As you should know by the time you are reading this review, that the point of the game is to act as crew member in a airship and destroy the enemy ship(s). While the game is simple in concept, there are as many tactics and strategies for this game as there are players. However, winning in this game always boils down to two simple things: teamwork and communications. Teamwork wins - every time.Positive:+ Easy to learn, hard to master.+ No cheaters & great community.+ Even losing can be fun.+ Teamwork is important. This is surprisingly and refreshingly different from other MP gamesNegative:- Look at the points on the positive side. This is not the game for impatient result driven loners.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 17, 2015
												This is a game about teamwork, communication, and tactical thinking. Between the interactions between crew members to keep a ship moving smoothly, the interactions between captains to coordinate attacks, and the spatial considerations in maneuvering in a 3D air environment to avoid taking hits while positioning yourself to dish out damage, this games offers some of the best gameplay available to take a group of people and forge them into a friendly fighting unit.Whether you have a group of friends looking to play together, or you are joining alone, if you are willing to open to fellow players, Guns of Icarus offers a unique opportunity to bond with local and distant gamers over the common goal of keeping an airship in the air.I highly recommend trying this game. If you find you enjoy the gameplay, I encourage you to look towards the forums and the clans. The depth of the strategy of the game is staggering even with the limited number of ship styles and guns.

content:
Posted: July 30, 2014
												I really like this game!! :) I'll tell you why!         [8/10] > In my opinion chatting could be easier than it is at the moment![ABOUT THE GAME - Ships, jobs, controls]There are different kinds of ships with guns on them. You can choose one of these ships before every gamestart. Also there are 3 jobs you can choose from before every gamestart (Pilot, Engineer and Gunner). A gunner is specialised in arming the guns on your ship and has unique equips and special bullets to load the guns with. Find enemies and shoot them down! An engineer is specialised in keeping your ship healthy and he will be mostly jumping around the ship to fix broken guns and parts of the ship. Also he can buff guns (if he has that tool selected). I haven't played alot of engineer myself yet. Then there is the pilot and he is the one flying the ship into - or out of - battles. You can speed - or slow down - your ship (R/F), increase - or decrease - height (W/S) and turn left/right (A/D). Also he has boosts and other stuff. Every ship has a crew, existing out of 4 players. You can form your own crew. Are you looking for 1 pilot, 2 engineers and 1 gunner on your team? or do you want 2 gunners and only 1 engineer? [INGAME]Ingame you are walking over the ship you selected, which makes the game more realistic. You have to walk to the engines or balloon to fix them or walk to the gun on the left or right side if you want to mount it. You have to look around for enemies. They can come from below or from above. They can suddenly show up from a dusty cloud. You have to be careful that you don't enter sandstorms that will damage your ship. Also there are mountains or shipwrecks on the map you have to move around. You can also choose to fly into other ships, but that might hurt.. There are multiple chatrooms ingame (Chat to Crew [your own ship], Team [your ship + Allied ship], Match [Allies + Enemies] ) and voicechat is also possible. [MULTIPLAYER AND FRIENDS]It's a really nice game to play with your friends. We just turn on skype, form a crew and there we go! Name your ship as you want. You can make your own clan too in this game. Every crewmember has their own roles and together you will bring your ship to victory! If you like games that require teamwork -> Definitely give it a try![CONNECTION]I'm playing this game on my 4-year old laptop that is getting slower every day. In the beginning it was really laggy when i got ingame. Too little FPS to play the game in a decent way. I turned down the video-quality a bit and now i can play the game really well without laggs and i still have good video-quality (Nothing is blurry or colorless). It's a colorfull map and things are sharp. I can see clouds and sandstorms that are nearing me. It might be that you have a low FPS the first few seconds when you enter a game, but once i move to the deck it's gone. I guess the connection is different for every computer, but i just want to point out here that you don't need a really expensive or fast computer to play this game.Hope this recommendation helped you out! :Dxoxo -Vero

												Guns of Icarus, a game my friend had assured me wasn't hard an was fun; he was definitely half right, as it was fun, yet my first match saw my ship go down with barely a single kill. Luckily i adapted, albeit slowly...One key thing i realised is team work is necessary, when playing with a friend, not only is it more fun but is it easier to manage a tag team esque battle. (Love this Game!)

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												Guns of Icarus is a perfect combination of teamwork and strategy as you try to outmanuvre your opponents and blow them out of the sky. Graphics are amazing. It is just a pretty game in general. Teamcomps are a bit stale as the Gunner class brings less to the crew than running 3 engineers and the pilot together. But then it is currently in beta at the time of posting so we will see what they implement here.However there is a large variety of perks for the classes, such as the lucky foot which increases the turn angle of your ship, as well as different weapon loadouts for the many ships available to use. These include things like mines and flamthrowers amongst the cannon and rocket like guns you would expect. This game is fun to play and even more fun if you can get a team of four friends to communicate with. alothough you have a voice chat option in game it is alot more difficult communicating to random players than to your friends over a service like mumble or skype. Overall the game deserves a much higher rating than the one it has been given and i hope to sink many hours into it as they bring out things like the adventure mode building up to the full release.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												THE SHORT REVIEW:A fun co-operative game to enjoy with friends, highly recomend the four pack if you do decide to pick this game up.THE LONG REVIEW:This game is quite literally co-operative, you will need to have someone doing their jobs or you and your teammates are screwed. Why did I recomend the four pack? It's best to play GoI with people you know or at least people who will put the co-op in co-operation cause if you don't then it will be difficult to coordinate different strategies. Not working together will and can get you killed, and not actually following through with the role of your class will warrant the same result.Guns of Icarus is a neat little game that caught me by suprise because I wasn't expecting it to, well, be fun at all. However the odd matches where friends weren't available to play the game got kind of boring, and it is definetly one of those games where you should atleast have people you know working with you (even though there is a chatbox and such).MADE FOR: Fans of Steampunk and Flying Ships. It's also made for those who actually have a group to play and communicate with.NOT MADE FOR: People that dislike games that run on Unity, and of course the whole setting of Steampunk. It's also worth noting that the game really isn't good if you have no one you know to play it with.GUNS OF ICARUS 7.5/10

												I don't quite get why everyone is hating on this game recently.  I'm aware that I haven't played as long as the veterans (obviously), but its not a bad game.First of all: The lobbies are not bad. They do take a bit longer than some games, but not as long as it takes to connect to GTA V Online...Second of all: The player count is lower, but you can still get a full team.  Third of all: Why do people care if the devs pay attention to the community or not? If there is a bug in the game, surely they will notice it and fix it.  And they are at least trying to revitalize the game with the DLC. Why would they release a DLC to a couple hundred players just for money?  They wouldn't, it's there to get more new players into the game.And to be fair, the game is quite fun. As the crew, you have to communicate with the Captian to be able to do what you must, and as Captain you must listen to your crew as well as pilot the ship independently.  And for $11.99, it is a very good game.

There is no "campaign" or story versus the AI. You'll be playing as a team - competitively against other teams. The game queue times aren't always short, but the individual matches last long enough to make the wait worthwhile. Even the least competitive players in our group of 4 were able to have fun with it. I would still wait for a sale before purchasing it though.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2014
												I wouldn't consider this game an action oriented game by any means, it's a strategy game. Everyone starts off with the same equipment, but you can customize your ship or your character to match your crew(always work in a 4 man group). There is no such thing as going lone wolf in this game. Each ship has 4 people on it, one controls it/gives orders,  and the rest maintain the ship and shoot other ships, which can be good or bad thing depending on your teammates/captain. There are three roles you get on this game: Engineer- Your main focus is repair, you are what keeps the ship going. Most of this play style is based on time management and focus; the difficulty of this class is based on the ship you're on. Sometimes you'll have an easy time maintaining the ship  and shooting guns when you have the chance, othertimes your focus will fully be on repairs. Since engineers are the ones who get around the ship the most, it's also handy to keep an eye out for enemy ships coming from the captain's blindspotsGunner- uses the guns, but mostly manages the rounds in that gun.The rounds you pick before the match begins are important, they decide the effect the gun has on your gun/enemy ship. Sometimes with this class you might need to make an emergency repair, but most of the time you're maintaining your gun and firing on the enemy ship. Each gun also affects different parts of the enemy ship in different ways, so play around until you understand what gun works best on what you're aiming at.Captain- As a captain, you organize your ship and your crew before the match begins, and then pilot the ship in game. You're the person in charge on your ship, and you work together with the other captain to decide how to attack or defend against the enemy ship. Communication as a captain is very important, along with strategy and picking your fights. A good knowledge of how the guns work and how your ship gets repaired can help in deciding what you can do with that ship.I would recommend this game if you like strategy and teamwork over brute force. The community is a close knit one where everyone knows everyone else practically, and is very open to helping new players along, so feel free to ask questions to higher level players or hop on ships and ask what they want you to bring/do. Just be patient, and have fun with it.

content:
Posted: September 4, 2014
Looking for co-op?Guns of Icarus is a unique game with an interesting concept. Our group purchased a 4-pack on sale and got a good night of gaming out of it. There is no "campaign" or story versus the AI. You'll be playing as a team - competitively against other teams. The game queue times aren't always short, but the individual matches last long enough to make the wait worthwhile. Even the least competitive players in our group of 4 were able to have fun with it. I would still wait for a sale before purchasing it though.

content:
Posted: May 22, 2014
												Had this game for a while but never bothered actually playing an online game until just recently. That said, I'm not sure how this game used to fare back then but it seems to have come a long way. I would go as far as saying it's one of the better games that requires some actual team effort. With your crew depending on an able Captain and or Pilot to steer them in the right direction and vice versa to keep the ship flying and fight back whilst under enemy fire.Some may say the different roles by themselves lack a bit of depth but I think their straightforward playstyle makes it more approachable to newcomers, and I'm doubtful if making it any more complicated would better the game. Furthermore difficulty comes with the ship you'll be flying on which depends on your crew Captain's choice and is open to customization at his/her will as they can be armed with different weapons to specialize in long and/or short range, and each ship has different stats and difficulty in management.As with many games based on teamwork, voice communication is a plus but like I said; because of how direct the roles are, a crew with a bit of commons sense would fare just fine without or by using the in-game commands / text messaging. On contrary to popular belief, the AI isn't as bad as one would think.. people write them off so easily because they are unaware of the existence of orders which if given properly and timely, make the AI a formidable crew not to take lightly. This is however my experience and may be subject to change on higher levels / advanced ships though I highly doubt it unless there's some kind of pathfinding issues.The game has been on sale many times before and packs quite some value at that because in it's current state I do think it's worth the normal pricetag. If you like being part of a crew on an air ship and conquer the skies alongside others in a setting a la steampunk this game is as close as you can get. The feeling of seeing your ship and or crew unleashing hell on your foes and landing those hits is exhilarating to say the least.

content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
												One of the best of competitive multiplayer genre and at the same time most underrated game I know. If you're one of those types who always wanted to feel like, let's say, Admiral Horatio Nelson and sail their own ship (or fly, in this case), or command a fleet, THIS GAME WAS MADE FOR YOU. The gameplay promotes teamwork among the crewmates and the other pilots of your team. The team tactics are interesting aspect of the game. There are numerous ships, tools, weapons and ammunition, each useful in different kind of situations. The combat itself: Long-range, close-range, ramming, stomping etc. - all in three-dimensions and that's awesome. The most you can get out of this game is if you play with friends and form a crew or a fleet, but if your peers prefer different genres like mine, it's still a great game to play as pilot solo.Absolutely recommend!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2013
												It's a great game to play and at the perfect price. If you enjoy steampunk ships battling it out in a beautiful open world then you will enjoy this. You work together in a team of up to 4 ships with a crew of 4 per ship. The classes are Gunners, Engineers, and the captain which is of course Navigator. Teamwork is a must in this game as you work together to give the ship life and flight. The devs of the game are nice, helpful, and can also been seen often in the chat when not busy working to improve the game or listenning to feeback. The community has also been very good and you will rarely ever find a troll in my experience. I can also safely say the game is not pay 2 win due to the fact the cashsop is only cosmetics. All you need to do is pick a role or even swap roles, pick a ship and the parts you like, or pick your ammo and head out to earn your fame.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												THE SHORT REVIEW:A fun co-operative game to enjoy with friends, highly recomend the four pack if you do decide to pick this game up.THE LONG REVIEW:This game is quite literally co-operative, you will need to have someone doing their jobs or you and your teammates are screwed. Why did I recomend the four pack? It's best to play GoI with people you know or at least people who will put the co-op in co-operation cause if you don't then it will be difficult to coordinate different strategies. Not working together will and can get you killed, and not actually following through with the role of your class will warrant the same result.Guns of Icarus is a neat little game that caught me by suprise because I wasn't expecting it to, well, be fun at all. However the odd matches where friends weren't available to play the game got kind of boring, and it is definetly one of those games where you should atleast have people you know working with you (even though there is a chatbox and such).MADE FOR: Fans of Steampunk and Flying Ships. It's also made for those who actually have a group to play and communicate with.NOT MADE FOR: People that dislike games that run on Unity, and of course the whole setting of Steampunk. It's also worth noting that the game really isn't good if you have no one you know to play it with.GUNS OF ICARUS 7.5/10

content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												Guns of Icarus is a perfect combination of teamwork and strategy as you try to outmanuvre your opponents and blow them out of the sky. Graphics are amazing. It is just a pretty game in general. Teamcomps are a bit stale as the Gunner class brings less to the crew than running 3 engineers and the pilot together. But then it is currently in beta at the time of posting so we will see what they implement here.However there is a large variety of perks for the classes, such as the lucky foot which increases the turn angle of your ship, as well as different weapon loadouts for the many ships available to use. These include things like mines and flamthrowers amongst the cannon and rocket like guns you would expect. This game is fun to play and even more fun if you can get a team of four friends to communicate with. alothough you have a voice chat option in game it is alot more difficult communicating to random players than to your friends over a service like mumble or skype. Overall the game deserves a much higher rating than the one it has been given and i hope to sink many hours into it as they bring out things like the adventure mode building up to the full release.

content:
Posted: January 14, 2013
												Very fun and engrossing action/strategy.  Airship battles set in a steampunk atmosphere.  Everything relies on your team working together which is made up of specialized members, ie unique classes/equipment loadouts which can be customized.  There is absolutely no "rambo'ing" in the game.  There are no individual stats displayed at the end of each round, although they are tracked so you can review them yourself, and do contribute to your character leveling up.  Leveling your character confers no in-game bonus, but does serve as an indicator of how much experience you have playing the game.  However, a team of veterans who do not pull together with their ship can easily be out-maneuvered and overpowered by a team of noobs who are actually working together, albeit even without a great understanding of how the game works.  This is accomplished by built in voice support which automatically moves you to channels for the game lobby and your ship, once the action starts.  The captains of the ships can also use a separate channel to plan strategy amongst themselves before handing out orders to their crew.  That's what makes it such an interesting dynamic.  The ships are competing, not the individuals.  The crews are completing, not the individuals that make them up.  It is also nice to play a game where the devs and mods play often and are available for questions.  They've even added a couple new maps since I started playing a few weeks ago.

content:
Posted: April 28, 2014
												10/10Where to start. To get my "opinion" out of the way, this is the greatest game I have ever played. Now that that is settled, to the game itself.I'm sure that you've read various other reviews telling you that the game is very team oriented. I cannot stress this enough, and let me tell you why. Since this is an FPS game, there is NO 3rd PERSON MODE. Not even as the pilot. This forces the crew members to cooperate with eachother in a way that I have never experienced before, and it is something to behold. Communication and cooperation are key, whether the balloon and engines need repair, the gunner is slightly out of range, a sandstorm is approaching from behind, or an enemy ship is right above you, everyone has to be ready to communicate."But thats impossible! No gaming community is cooperative, or friendly, enough to offer that kind of experience." Let me tell you that again and again the community that composes this game is not only the most friendly, but the most helpful that I have ever encountered. As a newcomer I knew this game like the back of my hand in no time, thanks to the help of some random players I met in game lobbies. The lobbies are full of fun times and cool people from all over, and everyone wants everyone to have a good game experience.Last, but cetainly not least, the gameplay. Flying these ginormous clunky ships is something you won't find anywhere else. It is a unique experience that requires a bit of skill and teamwork, but theres something so incredibly addicting and charming about it that just makes you want more. Your ship is stacked with customizable guns for different purposes, long range, medium range, short range, armor piercing, balloon damage, explosive damage, and tons more. There is always something to ready for, parts to repair and buff, guns to extiguish and load with the appropriate ammo, and enemies and hazards to be spotted. There are also environmental hazards, such as terrain to doge, weave, and hide around and sandstorms that sneak out out of nowhere.To put the gameplay in perspective, think of this: Your ship is charging out of a cloud at the unprotected side of an enemy ship. Gunners man the front guns and open fire while the captain rushes in for a ram. Your ship hits theirs and glances off to the right, while their ship spins around and is facing your right side. The situation is now a scramble, gunners running to the right side guns of the ship and trying not to fall off in the process, mechanic repairing damage to the hull from the ram, and the captain trying to get the ship out of the enemy's range of fire. The enemy ship is now facing guns forward at yours and starts pounding away with a mortars and a flamethrower, disabling your side guns and deflating your balloon. Your ship is slowly falling, the captain has decided to retreat and the whole crew is focused of keeping the hull in repair and the balloon inflated. Despite the crew's efforts, the hull's armor is down and the ship is now taking direct damage. Lucky for you, your ally ship bursts from the cloud in front of you and totally saves the day, finishig off the enemy and giving you time to repair. This is just a little taste of the exitement and thrill of this game.When I found this game, it was because I was looking for a cool steampunk game to play. This game has all the steampunk charm you could hope for, in the ships, in the setting, and in the customizable characters. As a steampunk fan, I can honestly say that this game completey satisfies my need for steampunk stuff. I love this game, I love this community, and I highly reccomend this game to anyone who wants to experience something new.

												if you like steampunk zepplines and fierce battles in the open skys using guns missles and everything in between then this game should be bought now. if you need more convincing this game is UNIQUE I mean it does things differntly and it does them well. you do everything from a first person perspective including fly the ship which makes the strategy of the game more apperent each ship ahs blind spots for both the pilot and the guns so you can sneak up on people or just slug it out you have to work with people in your crew. their is a lot of customization from your loadout to your ships guns. generaly the game is great the community is nice the batles are intense each person from the newest player to the oldest veteran have a job and the downtime fixing your ship just intensifys the action. finaly te ships are all well designed to add to the fun of play and they arent invincible by any means but they dont die easily you can survive most opening barrages and if you hide fix yourself up to fight again.  now of course this game isnt perfect the ships guns have really odd places they cant hit and the spotting is a bit finicky but this isnt gamebraking by any means i am realy just nitpicking and these problems get less and less each update.  if your still not convinced jsut find a freind who has it and play a few rounds with each class you will love it.

content:
Posted: April 28, 2014
												10/10Where to start. To get my "opinion" out of the way, this is the greatest game I have ever played. Now that that is settled, to the game itself.I'm sure that you've read various other reviews telling you that the game is very team oriented. I cannot stress this enough, and let me tell you why. Since this is an FPS game, there is NO 3rd PERSON MODE. Not even as the pilot. This forces the crew members to cooperate with eachother in a way that I have never experienced before, and it is something to behold. Communication and cooperation are key, whether the balloon and engines need repair, the gunner is slightly out of range, a sandstorm is approaching from behind, or an enemy ship is right above you, everyone has to be ready to communicate."But thats impossible! No gaming community is cooperative, or friendly, enough to offer that kind of experience." Let me tell you that again and again the community that composes this game is not only the most friendly, but the most helpful that I have ever encountered. As a newcomer I knew this game like the back of my hand in no time, thanks to the help of some random players I met in game lobbies. The lobbies are full of fun times and cool people from all over, and everyone wants everyone to have a good game experience.Last, but cetainly not least, the gameplay. Flying these ginormous clunky ships is something you won't find anywhere else. It is a unique experience that requires a bit of skill and teamwork, but theres something so incredibly addicting and charming about it that just makes you want more. Your ship is stacked with customizable guns for different purposes, long range, medium range, short range, armor piercing, balloon damage, explosive damage, and tons more. There is always something to ready for, parts to repair and buff, guns to extiguish and load with the appropriate ammo, and enemies and hazards to be spotted. There are also environmental hazards, such as terrain to doge, weave, and hide around and sandstorms that sneak out out of nowhere.To put the gameplay in perspective, think of this: Your ship is charging out of a cloud at the unprotected side of an enemy ship. Gunners man the front guns and open fire while the captain rushes in for a ram. Your ship hits theirs and glances off to the right, while their ship spins around and is facing your right side. The situation is now a scramble, gunners running to the right side guns of the ship and trying not to fall off in the process, mechanic repairing damage to the hull from the ram, and the captain trying to get the ship out of the enemy's range of fire. The enemy ship is now facing guns forward at yours and starts pounding away with a mortars and a flamethrower, disabling your side guns and deflating your balloon. Your ship is slowly falling, the captain has decided to retreat and the whole crew is focused of keeping the hull in repair and the balloon inflated. Despite the crew's efforts, the hull's armor is down and the ship is now taking direct damage. Lucky for you, your ally ship bursts from the cloud in front of you and totally saves the day, finishig off the enemy and giving you time to repair. This is just a little taste of the exitement and thrill of this game.When I found this game, it was because I was looking for a cool steampunk game to play. This game has all the steampunk charm you could hope for, in the ships, in the setting, and in the customizable characters. As a steampunk fan, I can honestly say that this game completey satisfies my need for steampunk stuff. I love this game, I love this community, and I highly reccomend this game to anyone who wants to experience something new.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												Guns of Icarus Online lets you slip into an intense battle on airships with explosions, chaos and drama. In a team of four, your goal is to wreck the enemie's ships while trying to stay above ground. The right ship with the fitting set of guns with a working crew is essential for victory.You can choose between three roles:♦Pilots are steering the ship and use a set of items to help them navigate. A very stressful role, because it's up to the pilot if the ship should engage the enemy, stay aside to the team or flee from battle. Therefor the pilot is mostly the captain who leads the crew and keeps them working as a unit. If you like to be a leader, this is your position!♦Engineers can rarely sit down and calmly drink a beer, as their job is to keep the ship together. With their set of tools they can rebuild, repair and even buff compoments of the ship. Whenever there's fire to extinguish, the engineer's here to save your head. Be the one who everyone should be thankful to that they are still alive!♦Gunners take their set of different ammunitions to the guns and choose the right kind to deal the most possible damage. Gunning is not to be underestimated because it does take skill to let a bullet hit the target when the pilot's driving like a drunken sailor. You are the one to burn enemies down with the flamethrower or rip their balloon into pieces with the canon!Communication is crucial in Guns of Icarus Online. For instance: The captain tells the gunner to man certain guns because he is about to position the ship in a certain way and engineers should focus on the engines because the captain burns them down with kerosine to gain speed. A microphone and the willing to talk are never wrong, but if you don't have one of the two things, you can use macros to share information, which is on my experiences enough. Text is also possible, but should be used carefully because it is likely that suddenly an enemy's firing at you while you are slamming keys on your keyboard.Because this game is filled with stressful situations and wrong decisions it's possible that crewmembers get frustrated and start to talk in a sharp way, but mostly the community keeps a cool head and tell you in a calm way what should be done and what should be avoided. If you are new in this game, there are novice gamelobbies where you play with people with about the same experience and most people are friendly enough to explain certain elements and rules. Ragequitters are marked with a low 'Match Completition Rate" and when a crewmember does leave the game, another player replaces the position pretty soon. In my whole playtime I 'only' had one griefer who surrendered immediately on the first death and blocked the gameplay instead of leaving the game, and in such cases you can report player for their behaviour fast and easy after the match.Different types of ships, a good selection of weapons and interesting maps are what makes this game enjoyable, but what's truly great is that every match is different. Every captain has their own strategy, situations change from a promised defeat to a glorious victory and there are hardly any boring pauses after the start of a match. It is incredible fun when you play this game with three other friends together and work out plans and maneuvers.Guns of Icarus Online is simply great!

content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												PLAY THIS WITH FRIENDS. I REPEAT- PLAY THIS WITH FRIENDS!Seriously, it would make your play experience much, MUCH better! Trust. Why? Well I'll tell you why. I'm just going to say that there are so many dang players that don't know what they are doing, engineers in gunner roles and vice-versa, captains going out of control for no apparant reason, etc. You know you are pretty much screwed when one of your guys can't distinguish between a shifting spanner and a rubber mallet.On the other hand, when you have a group of friends or out of pure luck- get people that knows how to play this game properly, this is where the game really shines out of all other indie games. The teamwork-based actions in trying to successfully take down your opponent's flagships is probably one of the best I've seen in any type of game that requires team effort. Sticking together with your other team mates is vital in winning your match.Only con I can think of is- why can't you die when you fall out of your airship? Pfft, yea I mean team effort, but it would be awesome with a bit of comical relief and realism added in on the side of the batch.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2016
												An incredibly fun game when you've got decent teammates. It's even fun when you lose, that's how good this game makes you feel. The mechanics feel solid (except for when you've got a really high ping, but my internet sucks here, so what can I say?), and there are multiple chances for customization as you level up in the game. My only problems are when that 1 guy out of 100 decides to be a total d-bag to everybody, and the fact that the upcoming DLC isn't free. In fact, it's more expensive than the game itself. It would be alright, I guess, if they treated it like a second game so you didn't have to purchase this one to get it, but alas, it would seem not to be so. At any rate, the game right now is incredible to behold, and the team play and epic sky battles are something else you'll most likely never see anywhere else.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												This game heavily emphasizes teamwork.  In the beginning levels of the game, with the straighforward deathmatch game mode, you can easily learn the ropes of the game.  The leveling system doesn't give anyone an advantage. Levels show that you know what you are doing and give people an idea of your overall skill level.  The game also isn't pay to win.  What you can pay for is cosmetic enhancements. Overall, GoIO has given me several hours of fun gameplay with my friends.  If you like co-op games based on team skill, then definitely buy this game. The devs put alot of effort into this game.  They even play and give free rewards if you can beat them.  They are still improving this game.  Even now, there groundworks for an adventure mode, based on the wreckages you can see in the battle maps that suggest a cataclysmic war of some kind.Edit:Adventure Mode!!!

content:
Posted: October 15, 2015
												The only game in which you and three other players are literally stuck in the same boat.You can't jump in a match and do ... whatever. That doesn't fly here. This game at a base level requires some degree of coordination. But bring a modicum of sense and attention (and the ability to communicate either through text chat or microphone), and the community will more than happily bring you up to speed.Some say Guns of Icarus is best played by buying a 4-pack and grabbing three buddies to play with you. That may be, but I wouldn't know, as I almost exclusively joined random matches for my first 800 matches, and had a complete blast doing so.The game hasn't had any major updates lately, but what's there right now keeps me coming back again and again. Also, keep an eye out for the Alliance PvE DLC.Another issue would be a relatively low (but stable) population. It seems to settle around 200 players during a weekday evening a couple months after the most recent sale. Check SteamCharts for more info. However, as the player population is mostly concentrated in the Americas and Europe, there might only be some 40 players or so when you decide to give GoI a spin 4AM in the morning. But you'll still be able to find a match, thanks to the existence of AI crewman! That is, as long as you're fine with flying the ship while everyone else on your ship is an AI.Point is, don't worry about never getting into matches.On sale or not, Guns of Icarus is quite the steal if it turns out to be your cup of tea. I highly advise those on the fence to watch some Youtube Lets Plays of the game. They'll give you a pretty good idea of what you'll be flying into.

content:
Posted: September 30, 2016
												Guns of Icarus Online is a splendid cooperative game which provides an experience you cannot get elsewhere. It rewards thought and coordination in a ship to ship steampunk package, challenging you to rule the skies!At the most basic level, you have two teams comprised of two to four ships, facing off against one another in a variety of modes. There are several unique ships to select, and each ship can be customized with different weapons based on their mounts/slots. Each crew consists of four people, who individually can select one of three classes, and then select class gear which they will use on the ship. This provides for a surprising amount of variability before you factor in player action in the game itself. You have to communicate and plan ahead, then adapt to the circumstances which emerge. As an individual, you are both essential to and dependent upon your crew. If you Pilot, you need someone else at Gunner to take your shots, and an Engineer to keep you flying. They in turn depend on you to approach, evade, and keep their weapons in arc or range. Even as a Captain of one ship, you need to coordinate with the other ship(s) to achieve your aims. You do not need a microphone - there are voice clips and text chat - but you need to speak and to listen, you all fly together, or you will be dashed apart.There is a very high skill ceiling which rewards both experimentation and analysis. Players start out with basic notions about roles, then uncover the details of a task (learning about main vs. secondary engineering, and the merits of different fire control tools), then find some tactical awareness (tacking to the side against this ship using this tool will allow us to hit their blind spot), and finally emerge into the strategic plane. Players keep learning and each learning leads to more exciting gambits and outcomes, which is why people can play this for thousands of hours.The community is close-knit and peculiar, with a strong core of pleasantly eccentric and capable veterans. If you have friends, you can take a ship with them, and if you don't, you'll probably make some in Guns of Icarus over the first weeks of play. You can also find rivalries, form or join clans, and generally have a splendid social time.In summary, if you are seeking risk and adventure in a high flying cooperative game which rewards both communication and cogitation, come aboard Guns of Icarus Online. We're always looking for fresh recruits, whether you know the difference betweent the bow and the stern, or aught that stems from either.

Posted: December 1, 2013
												This game provides a very unique experience that you won't find in other games. You can't quite describe the feeling - when you know the ship is going down, the captain isn't even at the steering wheel anymore but huddled in a corner wondering when it all went wrong, being razed by fire on both sides, all engines failing and balloon popped, you try and jump ship only to find yourself back on board... you'll have to try it yourself to understand. Gameplay is very balanced, nice variety of ships and guns and regularly updated for new content. The only criticisms I have are some lag/disconnection issues especially on foreign servers, and graphics aren't the greatest. The community is very friendly, and very competitive. Invest in a microphone, if you want to really get into it.

content:
Posted: April 24
												Guns of Icarus Online is a very fun online co-op/role-based game. It sets you in a dystopian, steampunk environment, as you and your crew man an Airship armed to the teeth. Hop in, find a good crew, and destroy your enemy!Need-to-knows:- Do all three role tutorials before starting. They are easy to figure out, but if you go into a game with no knowledge, your crew will most likely become annoyed with you.- I find this game a lot of fun by yourself, but some may not. It is definitely more fun with friends, and this game has crews of four. If you can find 3 friends, its an absolute blast!- This game has a built in push-to-talk system. If you can participate, it makes communication a lot easier. Know that a lot of users will use explicit language, but there is an audio setting just for it, you can turn it all the way down. There is even a way to completely disable it, so you won't accidentally active your audio.- It has pretty advanced graphics. I have a good computer, but an old computer. Often some things such as the flamethrower will cause my frames to drop quite low.- Each role can participate in other roles. Be prepared to adapt to many different scenarios.- AIs aren't all that bad if you have one on your crew, as captain, f1 will put them at ease. F2 will set them to attack. F3 will set them to repair! Utilize them to the furthest extent.- Faction can be changed, and it is not too important to the game. It is a lot of fun however!Roles:Engineer - Whack anything and everything, buff the engines, and keep the ship in the sky. A simple role, but a busy one.Gunner - Use the various guns to shoot down enemies. It is easy to aim, but various ammos and guns are required to take down ships. Be sure to learn whats what, after a time you can find some combos that shred through ships.Captain - Pilot the ship through thick and thin. Tell your crew what to do, play it safe and line up shots, or go in for a ram!I'd reccomend doing some 1v0 practice rounds before playing this role, and generally becoming comfortable with the controls.Ships:There are various ships in the game for various reasons. Pyramidion is best for ramming. Squid is best for speed. Galleon is a tank. Goldfish is extremely powerful, but only with a good team.I highly reccommend this game. All roles are fun, and even though its a seemingly basic game, it keeps me coming back for more!My Experience:- 26 hours in game.- I'm mostly an engineer, who usually mans the gatling part-time. I have experience as captain though, and have recieved compliments as a pilot from veterans.- I have 4 friends who own the game, as a group it can be an absolute blast, and be quite hilarious, too.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2015
												Guns of Icarus Online is a Steampunk Squad Based Fighter similar to Verdun. You pick from three classes: Pilot, Gunner, or Engineer and you and three of your mates fight in a Team Deathmatch or King of the Hill.For new players I recommend Engineer. Piloting has a steep learning curve, and everyone and their mother goes Gunner. If you master engineering, you will be invited to join many crews and have a better shot at applying for clans.The game requires you to work as a team, not only with your crew but the other ships on your team as well. Failure to work together -WILL- end in your defeat. So having a Microphone is a must if you are to play this game.There are Microtransactions, but only for cosmetics and they can be unlocked through gameplay anyways, so it doesn't feel like they are really there. I highly recommend this game.Graphics are good quality, this doesn't mean realistic, but it means that you do not see pixelation. Cons are: -There is no Singleplayer mode, so you will need a stable internet connection to play. -As always, it is best to play with friends as random players act like this is Rambo and will not work as a team.I rate this game a must play.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 9
												Long story short, this game is an excellent game, and it's worth every penny.Details:STUFF I LIKE:- Gameplay in general. I like the idea of flying these airships, I like the matching system, using the weapons is good, flying the ship has great controls, engineering is pretty intuitive, it just all works really well- The teamwork specifically needs special mention. It's really great. It forces you to work with not only your crew, but your entire team. They made giving commands and orders really intuitive. Working together with your team and crew is awesome, and it makes you feel like an essential part of a team, which is something not a lot of games have. - The aesthetics are great. I just like the way it looks. I'm not a huge steampunk fan, but this game really does it well. - Character customization. This seems small, but being able to customize my character is a big deal to me, so I had to mention it. It's really good. STUFF I DON'T LIKE:- This is an issue that I guess can't really be avoided, but some of the players are hostile, and it makes them hard to work with. I know it shouldn't be a big deal, but it's really frustrating when someone won't cooperate on a game that relies heavily on cooperation. - Leveling up. This is a personal issue, but it seems like you level up WAY too slowly. It just seems like it takes an awfully long time to make any real progress. Although, that may be a by product of my next point- It takes a long time to play the game. A match usually won't start until it's mostly full, which is frustrating because filling a match can take a really long time when people are as impatient as they are. I don't know how the developers might fix this, but on the other hand, that's not really my job.- It can be a little confusing. I know this isn't a big deal, but it took me a really long time to figure out how to use all the engineering tools and how all the different types of ammo worked. I feel like these could have been explained by the game a little better, but maybe that's just me. Overall, in spite of its flaws, I think this game is worth it. It can be a little tough to get started, but once you get going, it really is a blast. If you've got some time to set aside for it, it's really a great game.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 5, 2015
Pros: This game definitely fullfills your Steampunk fetish better than any other multiplayer game out there, including the MMOs.  Despite falling squarely into a heaping pile of Steampunk tropes, the game itself is refreshing & mostly original.  Teamwork is essential on multiple levels - both with your own crewmates and the other ships on your side.  Adding built-in voice chat was a wise choice indeed (It boggles the mind just how many games out there today still expect you to be running TeamSpeak, or whatever, in another channel.)  To my pleasant surprise, the game is remarkably absent the usual armies of drooling blockheads that populate most multiplayer combat sims, and the community is refreshingly non-toxic overall.  Truly a breath of fresh air hiding amongst the fart miasma that is multiplayer competitive gaming in general.  Trolls are a rare signt indeed, and that's a great thing.The graphics are simply stunning, especially for something still running in only 32bits.  There's enough eye-candy here to impress even old vet Skyrim players.  That's not just the skybox, either.  The ships themselves, the crews, the creaking of the hulls, the puttering of the engines.  It's not just pretty pictures - it's a compelte environmental experience that works on every level and at every distance.The game mechanics are mostly well done, and while the constant juggling of weapon & ship values by the developers may seem frustrating, to me that only shows that they still care about their game and are putting forth effort to maintain balance.  The matchmaking system isn't completely broken, which is something that I honestly don't think that I've ever experienced before.Also worth noting is that here is a game that has been out for literally years and to this day all of the microtransactions are still for cosmetic items only.  Think about that.  How many games out there have made it more than six months before they started trying to sell you golden bullets?  I can think of only one, and that's this one.  So major kudos for that.Cons: Map selection is iffy, and no matter what game style you pick it always deteriorates into deathmatch in short order.  While every map creates it's own problems and opportunities, it always boils down to "kill the other guy first" no matter what the actual rules of the match are.  But I suppose that's true everywhere.While people are usually brilliant at coordinating with their own crews, cooperation between ships seems to be lacking outside of "clan" players.  Not sure why.  But that's a people problem; it has nothing to do with the developers, so they're excused on this one.Security against hackers is... questionable.  I've seen some rather improbably things happen far too many times to believe that it was always a coincidence.  I can see someone scoring a critical hit on someone from BVR into a fog cloud with a full speed defelection shot once in a blue moon.  When it happens fifteen times in a row I just log out.  Not dealing with it.The biggest problem is the emphasis on "min/maxing" - a problem that has plagued them since day one and persists to this day.  Simply put, some equipment when places on certain ships in certain positions is simply best and nothing else can compare.  These are not tiny differences, they are major differences.  Because of this, despite all of the tweaking by the devs and the multitude of creative options available, the reality is that every single ship hull in the game has been refined into a single, proven configuration that everybody uses.  Likewise, because of this every single ship uses exactly the same tactics to maximize that one configuration and everyone knows it.  The problem with all of that is that it reduces the vast potential for strategic possibilities into a simple game of "rock, paper, scissors" and the outcome of a match is often determined before it even starts.  I've watched, laughing, as people have tried to "snipe" ship hull/template changes in during the very last second before a match starts.  I know the devs are trying to fix this, but so far... yeah, it's not working.Conclusion: Still a very fun game.  It's beautiful, fairly original, the community is realitively polite, and it has stayed true to it's "buy once, play forever" goal & doesn't try to shove it's microtransactions down your throat.  For that reason it's worth the money even if you don't play that often.  Right now it's only $10 and at that price you're definitely getting more than your money's worth.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 15
Product received for free
												THIS IS YOUR CAPTAIN SPEAKING! ALL HANDS ON DECK FELLOW SHIP CREW!Do you enjoy aviation & bombarding in the skies? Do you enjoy making your crew walk the plank over 5 thousand feet in the air? And one last question before I throw you into the engine room, can you fix those darn turbines quickly? WE'RE GETTING LOW ON ALTITUDE 'COZ WE'RE BEING BLASTED TO HELL HERE!Ahh yes, the frantic & stressful situation in managing an airship while admiring the beautiful sunset as your crew members run around fixing and manning the guns. This is one of the best co-op games I've got my hands on. You can choose your own style of playing and there's plenty good airships out there; Pyramidion my darling <3 . Not to mention the chaos that errupts as you're just nonchalantly cruising in the sky when suddenly you see fire coming out of your engine from the shots of a gattling gun 200 feet across the horizon. It trains your quick wits in handling emergencies as well as keeping a mentally balanced ship crew. Just make sure your crew or captain don't throw you overboard for lazing around. You can dress up your character too! Interested in Steampunk flight? They got you covered. Don't forget to have your decorations for the ship! Keep in style while bringing down your foes to a humiliating descent to death! The levelling up system requires task related to each crew class. Your item layout should vary with your strategies too. Wanna buff up your guns and engines? Don't forget the hammer! Wanna fly like a super sonic jet? Just kidding, you can't but there's a nitro boost which you can equip as a Captain. Love setting ships on fire? Then grab the incendiary ammo as the gunner. Discuss with your crew before a game! Don't forget to discuss the whole game strategy if you're playing with 3 other ally ships. Don't worry if you're just an underdog, just reach to the skies! OH WE'RE ALREADY HERE. REMEMBER CREW MEMBERS! THE SKY IS NOT THE LIMIT! KEEP FLYING!

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 14, 2014
												Fun 7/10^Very team dependant. One person slacking can ruin it. I have the most fun with real friends. Dont touch it much otherwise. Also, please have a mic.Graphics 6/10^Average. Not bad. Not amazing. They get the job done and will probably age nicely.Controls 10/10^ With keybindings it is hard to mess up on this. The game does what you tell it to.Replay Value6/10You can play this game forever. That would warrant a 10/10. HOWEVER, the game is not rewarding or rather, you play the same game over and over. Yes, different people make each match special.But imagine your favorite moba game. Everone has every character unlocked and there are only half as many characters. It is great fun for a while. But eventually, things get repetitive and dare I say boring.In Game Store10/10Not in your face.Purely cosmetic.Perfect.Balance5/10While the ships and weapons are balanced players are not. With a smaller community it can be difficult to fly with people of your level.That goes for within your own ship, and even against other players.If your engineer does not know what to repair, your gunner has bad aim, or your pilot turns your ship into a sitting target, it does not matter how good you are as an individual.Normally, this is where matchmaking, and some sort of player skill balance comes into play.But with a smaller community, this is not exactly the best choice to segregate players.Matchmaking5/10It can be difficult to get into a game.You can always find games.But, it can take a while.Game modes 4/10Plenty of game modes exist, and are played. I think this almost hurts the game though, because it puts players in a position of wanting to play a certain gamemode, and potentially nobody wants to play that mode. if 300 people are spread out over say 6 game modes(deathmatch,king of hill, crazy king, 2v2-3v3-4v4 etc) Not including different maps.Thats about 50 people maybe wanting to play with you. Take into consideration about 7 matches in each game mode and you are down to about 7 people trying to do what you are doing. That assumes no1 is afk or goes afk when you are making a match. To be fair, finding a match isnt always all that difficult. It more often than not requires a higher level of patience.Overall 5/10That isnt bad! It is decent, and fun will be had. It is worth a look. It is not your typical game. has its issues, but is solid fun.With actual friends 8.5/10Yes, there is a huge advantage to be had when playing with people you know and generally play games with. This is where the game shines. Plan to play with others, either make friends or get your friends to play with you. but fun will be had.

content:
Posted: October 23, 2015
												Guns of Icarus is a game that focuses heavily on cooperation and teamwork. You and 3 friends (or complete strangers) fly on an airship trying to destroy the enemy ships before they destroy you. In order to do that, you have to work together and communicate with your team, you can't do it on your own. This has resulted in best online community I've experienced so far. The game does have a learning curve, but it is not as steep as other competitive games, and the community loves to help those who show interest in learning the ways of the game.So if you are looking for a game where you can have a nice chat with other players and work together to achieve a goal, or just like competitive games, but want to avoid the toxicity you find in many other games, give Guns of Icarus a try!

												I got this game thinking there would be some cool engineering to do on these ships, but no such luck. All you do is run around clicking systems as they break, over and over, no steam-management type gameplay, no skill involved. Gets real boring and repetitive real fast. This is probably why the game is dead, 1 out of 3 classes is mind-numbingly boring, despite being essential to gameplay. Average of 160 players in the last 30 days and dropping steadily according to steamcharts.Only gunner and pilot are fun and take skill but you'll probably never get to play those because everyone will be trying to play gunner and pilot, avoiding boring engineer like the plague. Which is really a shame, because you can't win without an engineer, so you'll probably just end up having to choose between winning and having no fun whatsoever, or losing but at least you got to play gunner/pilot.

content:
Posted: October 11, 2013
												This is my new favorite game. The graphics as far as maps are minimal, yet the details of the ship are quite good. What makes this game is the online gameplay, hence Icarus "online". You play against and with other players from all over thr world in these massive balloon ships equiped with guns and cannons. Your objective is to take out other ships of the opposing tem by working together. This game is your worst nightmare if you can't get a crew to communicate. There are 3 classes: engineer, gunner, and captain. The 3 classes can do everything each class can do, but are more suited towards their trait.  The gunner: easiest class to play... fire and shoot at the enemy team. The engineer: fix broken weapons and engines, while also putting out fires... Most crucial player.  Captain: As you can guess, mans and manuevers the ship into danger and out. Has a few perks that can help escape enemy ships. Player base quality: Harcore players, griefers, and noobs. As in everygame.  One of my favorite things about this game though is character customization. There is a store you can use (costs real money) where you can pimp out your character in hats and all sorts of♥♥♥♥♥♥ Best part is it only costs around 30 cents or less for an item.  So just buy it.... I need people to play with me and yell at russians dudes with me.

Posted: June 1, 2014
												Short version: Its awesome, beware bugs and lag.I've been playing for 93 hours, and there are flaws, but I've loved all 93 hours I've sunk into this thing. The thing that keeps this game going for me is just the idea and exicution. The gameplay itself is wonderful, really reliant on teamwork and frankly, airships fighting each other without boarding is just friggen fun. But the bugs and the balance are desperate problems. Lag is sometimes like a mortal wound, bugs are lurking like traps to make you fall right through your ship, and the balance is being constantly ajusted. Such things have gotten much better since a year ago, when I joined, but I believe the developers are really working on their main project, which is adventure mode. Having only a small team working on both doesn't help either. Also it's worth mentioning that the devs talk to the community in game almost constantly.The devs are telling us that they're working to fix the game's problems.

Posted: February 17, 2014
												This is actually one of the few multiplayer games that I can actually stomach. Now, granted, even now this an unfinished game, in my opinion. But, nevertheless, I found immense joy in it.At first glance it's a simple cooperative multiplayer. And some of that simplicity stays. However the designers knew what to do to make this game enjoyable from the get-go.The whole crew is put under constant strain of keeping your ship in the air, and at the same time work on taking the opposing players' down. I would say that a certain bond is formed between the crew and the ship as every shell that hits feels like a slap across your face.From a technical standpoint the game could use some polishing, but being somewhat minimalist I find no problem with that. On no occasion have I encountered a serious, game stopping bug, although some graphical glitches still persist.All in all, a fun airship battle experience whether or not you bring friends along or join up on the spot

Posted: June 28, 2014
												Guns of icarus online is a super unique and super fun experience. the game is an airship combat game, where you and 3 other people crew an airship and co-ordonate to take down the enemy. For those unwilling or reserved about communicating (specifically verbally but also in text) with your fellow crew members it may be a little hard for you, as this game requires a large amount communication and co-ordonataion to function as each member needs to communcate to take down the enemy, whilst also keeping your own ship airborn.guns of icarus has 3 classes. gunner, engineer and pilot. each pretty much self explanatory as to what they specialize in. each class has different loadouts and skills they can customize to the players liking, along with how they look depending if you're willing to spend more money on cosmetics. Whilst admitably lacking in differing gamemodes besides how many ships can be fighting at a time (i.e 1v1 2v2 etc) the game makes up for it with a good variety of ship and weapon choices and the fact that each battle will mostly likely not play out the same twice. one team may have an upper hand one game but be absolutely stomped the next.If the idea of airship based combat where communication with your crew is key sound good to you, you'll most likely love Guns of icarus. its an excellent game and pretty cheap to boot. 8/10
