Posted: May 27, 2014
												This is a wonderful game. -It delivers what it offers, a great co-op game with intense gameplay. Community is really good, everyone usually follows orders, there are no rude people/trolls etc. to ruin your game. Devs regularly play the game and really clean up foul players. But as always, there are some stubborn people that "MUST BE A GUNNER!111!" or sometimes an engineer not doing their job and gunning instead, but these are rare occurances. As long as someone gives the orders, such things are avoided.-Game is well balanced and benefits highly from the use of tactics. It's not a rock-paper-scissors thing either, everything works as long as you know how to use them.-Servers are working just fine, even though I'm a bit far to Europe for instance(Turkey), I get 70-100 ms ping. Which is really good.-Crashes very rarely occur, I played for about 20 hours and experienced only one crash. There are minor bugs, but no gamebreaking bugs.-It has a online shop, but it's not a pay-2-win, the items are entirely cosmetic, and quite well priced. (If you're so inclined to decorate your ship and suit up your characters, it would only cost 10 dolars.)So in the end, do buy this game if you like teamwork and wreaking havoc with a flamethrower, because that's what you'll get.

Posted: February 24, 2014
												Delicious steampunk. This game is wonderful.  Airship to airship battle with strategy and teamwork. The crew on an airship needs to work together to be the most effective and communication is key.  You can be a gunner using a variety of guns and ammo to take down enemy ships. You can be an engineer fixing damage, putting out fires, and upgrading airship components. Or you can be the pilot strategically bringing the airship in and out of combat to minimize damage taken, catch the element of surprise when possible, and to always keep the best guns for the job in range of the target. The game looks pretty good and the background music is nice. Ignore the metacritic score because it is deceiving.  This game is a lot of fun and I highly recommend it.

Posted: February 20, 2014
												Guns of Icarus Online has a wonderful teamwork aspect to it in which most other games don't really provide. Most games have a certain objective and then everyone can go off and do their own thing. With this game, you all have to work together and provide key communication in order to own the skies and take the victory.The game's graphics may not be as high as big brand games, but they sure are detailed enough to get the point across. The engine performs amazingly and I have had no trouble whatsoever in figuring out how to play. The controls are put up on screen (providing you kept the tips on) so that even the most novice of players can get a grip for the controls.Customization is also very big in this game. Not only can you customize your character's appearance, but you can customize your ship down to the last weapon. Want a flamethrower on your vessel? Go right ahead! The game already has a large selection of weapons for you to use so go ahead and use them!All in all this game is great and it really does show in the dynamic of its performance, quality, and playability. The easy controls, stunning design, and almost limitless customization makes this game perfect for those who seek action, and great team playing.

Posted: February 13, 2014
												This game has what a steam punk junkie needs. Well, at least for air-ship to air-ship combat. Play a pilot and fly your ship through the maps and out wit you enemies, or shoot them down as a gunner with any of the veriety of weapons mounted on the ship or, keep your crew alive with one of the most important rolls by bashing parts back together with a wrench as an engineer. This team based game is also just as beautiful as it is spectacularly entertaining. The graphics shine brightly and have a bit of an old timely grain to them as if being watched through an old film projector and on some maps the rain splashes in your eyes obscuring your vision slightly. The best thing about this game is the community though. Developers are constantly online taking notes and playing in matches with the players and the players themselves have been nothing but friendly sore the occasional troll or angry Russian pilot. The game does fall flat on a few things though such as game type veriety and the ungodly A.I. engineers as well as some unbalanced ship builds and the fact that pilots, gunners and engineers have no significant advantage over one another accept for having more equipment for their assigned rolls. In the end the game is under constant change and I hear that more game modes are on the way, as well as maps, ships, guns and most importantly hats.Sk00mathief

Posted: September 14, 2015
												The feel and thrill you get when engaging in ship to ship combat and having to rely not only on your personal skills but on your own crew mates' as well is something you don't usually find in gaming.This is a game about cooperation and communication in a way that "realistic" war games fall short miles from.It is the most rewarding online experience I've had in years. Unique gameplay experience. Keeping me at the edge of my seat in a way I haven't seen in ages.Picture a stylish steampunk balloon under enemy fire: the Engineers are running around putting out fires and frantically fixing components, barely keeping up with the mounting damage; the Gunners are trying to return the damage they are taking with interest and maybe neutralize the enemies' guns and vital components to give themselves better odds before their own guns are taken out; the Captain is flying a ship with half the engines blown, the best gun out of commission and the balloon about to burst has to decide whether he can attempt to make a run for it or if it is better to bring all guns to bear and go down in a blaze of glory.

Posted: July 12, 2014
												Guns of Icarus as a steampunk based zeppelin battle game consisting of the gamemodes Team Deathmatch, King of the Hill and Conquest; all the while with enviromental hazards and beautiful ethreal landscapes. This game is great for those that communicate via mic. Allthough mic communication is a strong suit, it is also a down fall. This game requires people to do certain specific jobs, so If the pilot and crew (Gunners/Engineers) dont inform eachother of their situation, the ship will breakdown in fire and eventually blow up. Everyone seems pretty up to speed though. The mic is particularly most important for the captain, If there is no mic available the player can proceed to use key voice commands. It is pretty much pirate ships powerd by Balloons and Engine Propellers.  The guns themself are a much different calibur then a typic pirate ship. Which forces decisive planning. The community itself is a bunch of characters. This is a very multicultural game where i've run into people from Europe and the U.k. (I live in the U.S.)  In the end, victory feels really like an acomplishment, which is always a plus in games. If anyone is interested in buying this, know your tools and abilities (4 slots to swap out in the lobby), it really helps due to the games being open match. Real people real trash talk consequences, and as for people on the internet go, they can be harsh, but as for the main tip, stay informed!  10/10 for maintained interest.

Posted: May 25, 2014
												Pros + Cons-+Community+Gameplay+Ship customization+Class customization+Music+Atmosphere-Microtransaction cosmetics-Terrible AI-Player animationsFinal Score: 7/10If you love games with teamwork, games with great communities, or games with huge clunky armed airships, then I suggest this game.When you first go into the game, you are treated with an excellent theme song.  The string instruments mixed with cannon shots mixed with propellers really set the tone for the game.  I find myself humming the theme song whenever I start the game.Jumping into the tutorial, I felt a bit overwhelmed.  It's telling you to do all of this stuff and at the time I didn't know what the hell they were talking about.  But if you just just take is slowly then you will be able to understand.  If you have any question, just type it into the global chat and people would be happy to answer!The character customization is great and all, but for most of it you have to pay.  If this game was free to play than I would be fine with it, but the game is $15 full price, so it's not ideal.  It's not just character cosmetics, but ship cosmetics as well. However, there is some items you can get by leveling up, I was informed you could battle the devs every Tuesday and Thursday to get some snazzy cosmetics.Thankfully, you can customize both your ship and character layout.  You are given an ample amount of ship types to choose from, each with their own advantages and disadvantages, they are all very different from each other.  Not to mention that the game also has a bunch of weapon choices, all have unique uses.  Experimenting with different ships, guns, and even ammo is a hell of a ride.When you're customizing your character loadout, you have a choice of three classes: Pilot, Engineer, and Gunner.  You also have three catagories of items, each one corresponds to a class.  You can pick one item from two catagories, and three from another catagory, it all depends on your class.  If you're a gunner, you can pick one pilot item, one engineer item, and three gunner items.  It's a good system.The game requires coordination, so make sure you talk with your crew about a plan before the game starts, it will help out a lot trust me.  You'll have time to do this, due to the fact that it takes a while for a game to start most of the time.  This is because not many people play the game, so it takes a bit for the lobbies to fill.I'm not going to say much about going into your first battle, because I don't want to spoil the feeling.  All I have to say is, hold on to your♥♥♥♥♥because you're going on a wild ride.I recommend you go in with a full crew, not AI.  The AI is horrid in this game, it is impossible to win with a crew full of them.This next complaint is small, but it just bugs me a bit that the player animations are lazy.  I don't know how to explain it, but they aren't great.In conclusion, this game has a great atmosphere and great gameplay.  Just a few small gripes keep it from being pefect, so my final score is 7/10.  Go check it out.

Posted: October 27, 2012
												Guns of Icarus Online - Now there's a unique, little game. Set in a steampunky universe, you and three friends/randoms/AIs man a heavily armed airship through treacherous cliffsides or dusty dunes and engage the enemies 1-4 ships at range or in tight dogfights. The arsenal of weapons is decent, with new ones added through patches. A few different ships allow you to play the game like you want it - as a fast, harassing mosquito or as a well-armed and armoured battleship. As with weapons, new ships have been announced and will probably be added eventually. As far as customisation goes, currently you can only modify the character you play as, give him/her a nice outfit, a hat and accessories. According to the devs there will even be a sort-of open world aspect in the near future, allowing you to play as a merchant, pirate or mercenary. Even now, though, the game is definitely worth checking out if you want something that stands out. Heaps of fun with some buddies!

Posted: July 18, 2015
												You get into a lot of games with players that don't listen and incendiary players and players that have no intention to learn. Sometimes the matchmaker is slow, and if you're a captain type like me it takes a while to get into the swing of things, with a pretty steep curve. But then you get into a match where everyone is working in sync, everything clicks, and it all becomes worth it. And in these instances you will get the best multiplayer team experience I believe to currently be in existance. You become a well oiled kill-machine intent on making every opponent you meet into a scaled to life model of the hindenberg. Also the devs are really cool and really active with the community, which is a refreshing change of pace.

Posted: June 30, 2014
												This is the ultimate teamwork-centered game.You play as one man on an airship. An airship that requires a pilot, gunners for each weapon, and mechanics to repair everything on the fly. You have three other players with you, one allied airship with its crew, and two enemies with their crews.Alone you will die. Together you will devastate.Dramatics aside, this is a game where you MUST work as a team. Gunners must talk to their captains to line up shots and coordinate damage types for best effect, engineers must time their wack-a-mole repair circuits to keep the armor solid and balloon floating, and the Captain must bring it all together as they try and manouver a eight-ton ship through clouds and desolate landscapes to evade and return fire. Let me be clear: you NEED A MIC to to play and enjoy this game.There are no gameplay-affecting microtransactions, only cosmetic, and all gear and ship options are unlocked from the start, so you will not get demolished by a Rank 14 ship because he had a better gun that you. The Achivement-based ranking system is a little weird, but gives a pretty good indication of how experienced a player actually is.The community is wonderful, as those that play actually want to play as a team, because that is the only way to win. A few screaming nine-year-olds that insist they are amazng captains show up every once in a while, and a few obnoxious jokers, but all-in-all the biggest annoyance is a captain without a mic (which is a completly valid excuse to bail from a lobby). Wonderful game, super-competitive, super tactical, and you have an excuse to talk like a Brit. I mean, come on! Steampunk Airship Battles! You have to put on a accent!

Posted: October 27, 2014
												This game is so much fun to play. There are several classes you can play as; engi, gunner and pilot or captain class. Gunners are obviously responsible for shooting the enemies, destorying parts on their ships, and ultimately their goal is to kill them. There are many different guns and ammo types. Of course, for different gun different ammo is needed because it works in the gun better and is more effective at destorying the enemy. Typically your captain will suggest ammo but you may want to ask them what they want. OH, and always check the captains ship load out so you can see what guns are on there and if you already know what ammo works best equip it and double check with captain. Engis are like the glue of the whole airship, they are responsible for rebuilding parts on ship that have been destroyed, restoring health to damaged ship parts, and putting out fires, buffing equipment etc. The captain is the ships "brains", they steer the ship, use their captain tools to make the ship go faster, higher etc. Its loads of fun to play with your friends because it is an online mutliplayer you are always playing with people, making new friends. It also has clans that you can join and become part of their extended family and things. Its quite fun and i'd recommended any one buy it when it is onsale, seeing as its a good use of money and can be played for hours on end. I'd also recommend doing the tutorial b/c ppl get mad at new players often for just jumping on into games especially when they don't listen to load out recommendations or seem to know what they are doing on the ship. Plus doing the tutorial gives you a better understand of the classes and their specific roles on the ship.

Posted: May 13, 2014
												If you are expecting a full-blown MMO that takes place in the skies, this game isn't for you. If however, you would like some 16 player 4 ship multiplayer battles in the sky, in the style of a MOBA, then you will have a blast. The game is very well balanced, and stresses teamwork more than being a good shot/pilot/engineer, which is aided by the team and lobby voice chat built in. This game is a blast, and having gotten the collectors edition with 3 extra copies of the game, I am able to have a full crew of me and 3 friends for just 7.50, thanks to the recent sale. For someone who does not like MOBAs, or FPS's, this game is a blast, and I can already see myself sinking massive numbers of hours into it. 4 stars.2 year edit:Game is still going strong, has regular surges of people everytime it goes on sale, to about 1000-2000 players on at a time, and then drops down to about 250 during the off-sale times. Few recent updates revamped some of the strategies, and balanced out a lot of weapons and loadouts, so no more gatling-moartar pyrimidions blotting out the skies with their sheer numbers. Still would recomend picking up the 4 pack of the game, it's dropped down to 7.25 on at least 6 occasions I can recall. This is a blast to play with friends, and I will keep playing this until star citizen comes out and I can play this with spaceships. 5 stars.

Posted: May 19, 2014
												At the time of writing I have enjoyed my first 12 hours of the game. To give a bit of background, I prefer to play with friends rather than on my own or with random strangers in any game.Get one or two friends together and your sure to have a good time. You don't have to be able to shoot straight (unless you're a gunner) and you don't have to be an able pilot (unless you're playing pilot) thanks to the engineer class who is in charge of keeping the ship together, putting out and preventing fires, and buffing the weapons and engines to give an edge to the battle.AI crewmen are second rate compared to human players and I recommend that you get as many people together as possible before starting the match; this is where the game shows its negative side, it can take ages to get a match going as the smallest matches require 4 ships with at least 1 human captain each.The community has been nice thus far, aside from the odd♥♥♥♥♥♥measuring flame war, most players you meet are either dead silent or pleasant to talk with. The game comes with a wide variety of airships for different play styles, all of which are unlocked from the beginning (unless you are playing in "novice matches"). Each ship can be equiped your own custom load out of guns, it is highly recommended that you (as designer) listen to your gunners request for which guns they want on it, otherwise you may alienate them.

Posted: May 19, 2014
												This game is fantastic, and I love what the developers are doing with it. Its constantly being updated, and is probably one of my favourite multiplayer games; it has got something for everyone. Love leading  a team into combat and supporting them by getting them in just the right position like myself? Play pilot. Rather shoot down enemies witha variety of guns and bullet buffs, darting from position to position and yelling at your captian for not getting into the right postion at the right time? Play gunner. And if you would prefer to get yelled by everyone while keeping the ship in the air and running around like a mad man, you would make the perfect engineer. While I know that my review involves a lot of yelling, the community is amazing and on that I'm proud to be a part of. Ignore the Metascore. This game is amazing. Allons-y!

Posted: August 13, 2014
												Guns of Icarus is in a nutshell, an FPS version of FTL but in its own way, its very unique. In a almost sprawling lore into a steampunk universe, a crew of 4 including you consiting of engineers, gunners and pilots, you and you crew work together in PvP matches to not only keep your ship afloat, but to make sure others dont do the same. With a range of weapons, from massive long-range mortors to short range flmaethrowers, you will find your place in a massive range of ships from the gun-heavy Galleon to the light and versatile Squid. You as a player will be immensly unique to others, with costumes consisting of hats, suits, glasses and so forth to your very characters skills in engineering, shooting, piloting and, (stressing this!), Leadership.Its now up to you. Will you conquer the skies through immense brute force and willingness to prevail? Or will you be cunning and corageous amongst your crew members and carry your reputation across the plains of sand and steel?

												This game is amazing.It's the next level of cooperation. You are not just a team pursuing a single goal.4 players here are part of an organism. Look up "Guns of icarus development Lore" on Youtube. You'll see how hard They worked to accomplish what They have now. This rises another question. Posted: November 26, 2013
												For an indie game, this game is DEFINITELY WORTH the asking price! The game takes a bold direction by putting players in flying airships in a fancy steampunk- themed world. Teamwork is essential here, as you and three other players, each playing one of 3 different roles: Gunner, Engineer, and Pilot...must work together in order to ensure a decisive victory over your opponents in the skies! Gameplay is fun, addictive, and well- balanced (for the most part). A fresh change of pace from your typical team- based pvp game. It's just such a shame this game isn't more well- known....Highly recommend playing this game with a group of friends.

Posted: February 13, 2014
												This game has what a steam punk junkie needs. Well, at least for air-ship to air-ship combat. Play a pilot and fly your ship through the maps and out wit you enemies, or shoot them down as a gunner with any of the veriety of weapons mounted on the ship or, keep your crew alive with one of the most important rolls by bashing parts back together with a wrench as an engineer. This team based game is also just as beautiful as it is spectacularly entertaining. The graphics shine brightly and have a bit of an old timely grain to them as if being watched through an old film projector and on some maps the rain splashes in your eyes obscuring your vision slightly. The best thing about this game is the community though. Developers are constantly online taking notes and playing in matches with the players and the players themselves have been nothing but friendly sore the occasional troll or angry Russian pilot. The game does fall flat on a few things though such as game type veriety and the ungodly A.I. engineers as well as some unbalanced ship builds and the fact that pilots, gunners and engineers have no significant advantage over one another accept for having more equipment for their assigned rolls. In the end the game is under constant change and I hear that more game modes are on the way, as well as maps, ships, guns and most importantly hats.Sk00mathief

												This team based game with battle zeppelins, it's post-apocaliptic steapunk/dieselpunk based setting. Guns of Icarus are a teamwork nor merely team based game, and I havent seen any game better at it thus far. You are 1 of 4 ship's crew members and your goal is to destroy enemy airships. Teamwork is a requirement if you want to win or have fun (there is a lof of fun to be had with proper people). Posted: June 19, 2015
												I'll have to split my review into two parts, one for the game itself and another for the community of players I've encountered:1.) The Game: Guns of Icarus is a steampunk-themed airship combat game with 4 players to a ship. Between them the roles of gunner (primary gun user), engineer (repairs/rebuilds/puts out fires/enhance equipment) and pilot (pilots, obviously) are assigned. It's a beautiful game, and the variety of ships and gun types allows a crew to tailor to their fighting style very well. Piloting controls are a little awkward, but that's likely by design. It relies heavily on communication, so playing with friends is best, but that leads me to the second part...2.) The Community: This game has one of the best community of players I have ever seen. Although there are a few bad apples, the majority of players I've randomly queued with have been good-natured, communicate well, and don't talk other team members down. This, in my opinion, makes the game go from good to great. If you have to queue yourself, it's not something to dread, you can still find very fun groups to play with. Just have your headset ready, or type quickly, because you MUST communicate.

Posted: July 18, 2013
												A competitive ship based game that relies on group cooperation and crew communication, Guns of Icarus is a unique team multiplayer experience. You play as one of three roles on a steampunk style airship as part of a crew of four. You then work together with your fellow players to keep the ship in prime condition as you engage other vessels. Pilots take the helm, engineers make sure everything is at prime condition, and gunners fire upon threats. No one is more important than the other and there is no emphasis on becoming the star player. The best players are cogs in a well oiled machine along with their crew, as it's their ship that's the star.While I think this game is definitely worth full price, as a strategy I suggest grabbing this game during any kind of sale and if you enjoy it, then make up the difference by purchasing some of the cosmetic microtransactions available. This is not play to win. All ships and weapons are unlocked from the start, but if you wish, you can purchase little bits and bobs to make your character look good and make a special outfit for each class. Additionally, an adventure mode DLC is coming soon which will contain a cooperative campaign, so even more reason to fly with some friends!Aesthetically, the game looks stellar with fantastic environments to fly along and beautiful skies. The music is atmospheric and tense all at once, not taking away from the experience. Subjectively, character models look good for the most part, but male faces leave something to be desired and there are some blurry textures on pieces of the environment yet the ships themselves are lovingly put together and textured.The gunplay with the weapons feels good, and depending on the weapon you have, you can tell there's a lot of power behind it. Some weapons feel a bit lackluster, like the gatling gun. While it does a great job in damaging an enemies hull, it just doesn't sound like a powerful gatling gun as you'd expect. That's really the only weapon I've found that doesn't feel great handling. Additionally, it's absolutely amazing (Or terrifying if it's the enemy) seeing a vessel firing their payloads on another.Controls wise, this game handled great. Flying a ship feels realistic, momentum plays a factor, and you do feel like you are actually piloting something. Running around on foot is just like any FPS and is perfectly responsive (Just don't forget to turn off mouse smoothing). Keep in mind, that while you can control the character like an FPS, it's not an FPS. Boarding is not a factor and for good reason. It's not about killing players, it's about killing ships (Which have players on them), and players must work together to do such.In conclusion, the developers seem very excited to continue improving their game and just looking on the forums show they are quite dedicated to it. If you're at all interested in an awesome multiplayer experience that focuses on ship crews and working together, then take to the skies!

Posted: August 14, 2014
												This is a game about having teams of four each in one flying zeppelin-like ship trying to blow up the enemy's vessels at the same time they try to hold their own together in one piece. Whether the objective is just destroying the opposite team, capture a point or any other thing, team work is essential to keep the ship flying. There are three classes you can pick: Pilot (usually the crew captain as well, since he is the one chosing the ship; has perks for piloting), Gunner (packs different kinds of ammunition to supply the ship's weapons) and Engineer (has multiple repairing tools and sometimes buffers to face any damage the ship could suffer). While any class can do any job, each one has something in which he is better at than any other. You can use the ship's guns to shoot the enemy's and depending where you hit, the rival vessel will recieve damage in different coponents and then suffer negative effects until repaired. Team work will be needed both between ships in the same team and within the ship's crew itself. Better bring some friends.+ Good graphics and entretaining gameplay.+ Multiple ships to try out, each of them with customizable layout. All have strengths and weaknesses.+ Three customizable classes to play.+ The battle system is great and intense. Will require a lot of strategy.+ All ships, weapons, tools and perks are available from the start, but you'll have to choose which ones you want.- If the crew doesn't work together, or at the very least follow the captains commands, the ship is doomed. Period. You can still loose by playing alongside the team, but not doing that almost grants that you won't win. Building up a crew just with friends is most of the times the best thing you can do.- Is almost mandatory to have a microphone when playing this game, or otherwise being a fast typer, since you'll have to communicate with the rest of the crew if you want to have any chance of winning.- The "Novice Player" status is given to you automatically until you reach level four in any of the classes, which doesn't allow you to use some ships and forces certains layouts in the one you can use, and that kindda sucks. However, it can be disabled in the configuration menu.This game gets a 8 out of 10.

												Short version: Its awesome, beware bugs and lag.I've been playing for 93 hours, and there are flaws, but I've loved all 93 hours I've sunk into this thing. The thing that keeps this game going for me is just the idea and exicution. The gameplay itself is wonderful, really reliant on teamwork and frankly, airships fighting each other without boarding is just friggen fun. But the bugs and the balance are desperate problems. Lag is sometimes like a mortal wound, bugs are lurking like traps to make you fall right through your ship, and the balance is being constantly ajusted. Such things have gotten much better since a year ago, when I joined, but I believe the developers are really working on their main project, which is adventure mode. Having only a small team working on both doesn't help either. Also it's worth mentioning that the devs talk to the community in game almost constantly.The devs are telling us that they're working to fix the game's problems.

Posted: May 21, 2014
												If you ever wanted to be a mighty sky pirate piloting your own ship and crew, an engineer who franticly runs between the upper and lower decks of the ship repairing stuff of your flying metal coffin, or a gunner who is just a tad bit to enthusiastic to be disabling the enemies ship systems 1 by 1 like their that creepy kid on the playground that tears the limbs off of insects, Guns Of Icarus may just be the 4 player multiplayer co-op for you!Since you will be stuck on a small ship with 3 other players, teamwork is a must if you wanna keep that hunk of junk in the sky making you only as strong as your weakest link. The online community is rather great when it comes to this concept, and most of them have mics so you can still have quite a bit of fun, even if your friends don't seem to be all that interested in joining you for some co-op aerial combat goodness.The ships all handle relatively smoothly, and offer a difference that makes each one feel just a slight bit varried. Wether you're using the Squid for hit and run tactics, the Pyramidion for those that like to get in close, stay close, then ram the opponent as a final insult to injury, or the Galleon. A massive warship built to tank, and give as good as it can get to any of those more fragile ships. The guns your ship comes equipped for the most part feel right, the majority of which are projectile based and not hit-scan. Projectiles meaning of course they have to travel through the air and are effected by your ship as it sways and turns, and hit-scan meaning it deals damage instantly as soon as you click on an enemy ship. The only gun I've noticed some hickups with is the flare which never seems to want to go anywhere near the target at mid range no matter how you aim it.The game has a few weird hangups. Namely the push to talk lag for anyone using a laptop to play, some latency issues which aren't a major problem since the game isn't an fps, and an occasional weird glitch or bug where you might just suddenly fall off the ship, or not be piloting it. Thankfully the bugs aren't frequent enough to be a real bother.If you're looking for a multiplayer experience that thrives on communication, have a hankering for some aerial combat, and can look past a few of the rough edges you'll be in for a good time.

Posted: August 6, 2014
												An excellent game with an even better community, which is mainly what makes it so great. The gameplay itself is often manic, and extremely good fun - but you'll need to collaborate with your 3 other crewmates in order to take down enemy ships (I cannot stress enough how important it is to have good communication with your crew, as well as good tactics). The voice chat feature makes this very easy, but if you don't fancy speaking to strangers over the internet, there's a text chat option as well - most people are very friendly! Communication and familiarity with your crewmembers is greatly aided by the clan system, which forms the basis of the online community: you can get to know people in your clan and develop rivalries with other clans, against whom your clan may be pitted in the frequent tournaments that take place. Tactics play as important a part as execution in this game, with captains of the ship able to change ship loadouts to suit their crew and opponents; ship customisation is also available. All three roles of gunner, engineer and pilot are very fun to play, and you'll soon find which one you like best - most people start with engineer as it is often the most straightforward, at least when you're new to the game. There is a fairly comprehensive tutorial system inbuilt, as well as the game forums for more information and excellent community guides. My only complaint would be that it takes a very long time to level up all of your classes, as this is done by earning achievements and not directly controlled by the amount of time spent playing the game: but this is clearly a deliberate choice made by the developers (who, incidentally, are very active in the community) and you still have a great time playing the game.In short, an excellent little game that will keep you absorbed for a long time as you grow familiar with its nuances and finer tactics.

Posted: May 19, 2014
												At the time of writing I have enjoyed my first 12 hours of the game. To give a bit of background, I prefer to play with friends rather than on my own or with random strangers in any game.Get one or two friends together and your sure to have a good time. You don't have to be able to shoot straight (unless you're a gunner) and you don't have to be an able pilot (unless you're playing pilot) thanks to the engineer class who is in charge of keeping the ship together, putting out and preventing fires, and buffing the weapons and engines to give an edge to the battle.AI crewmen are second rate compared to human players and I recommend that you get as many people together as possible before starting the match; this is where the game shows its negative side, it can take ages to get a match going as the smallest matches require 4 ships with at least 1 human captain each.The community has been nice thus far, aside from the odd♥♥♥♥♥♥measuring flame war, most players you meet are either dead silent or pleasant to talk with. The game comes with a wide variety of airships for different play styles, all of which are unlocked from the beginning (unless you are playing in "novice matches"). Each ship can be equiped your own custom load out of guns, it is highly recommended that you (as designer) listen to your gunners request for which guns they want on it, otherwise you may alienate them.

												-=Add Ageotas to your friendslist, and I am always happy to teach new people.=-Guns of Icarus may well be the most exciting and engaging game I have played. No other game places more focus on teamwork and cooperation, while maintaining a great atmosphere and hours of fun. The community is active, vocal, and happy to teach new players, and the Post Apocalyptic Airship theme is immensely refreshing and exciting.The attention to detail on the ships, the maps, and the player models is exquisite, and the soundtrack is subtle but engaging. The developers take a particularly active role, with constant updates, community feedback sessions, and they even regularly jump into the game and play along side you!Seriously, I cannot recommend this game enough, and I look forward to seeing more and more people take to the skies.

Posted: September 22, 2016
												This is very much a teamwork-based game.You are on a ship with 3 other people and all of you must work together to keep the ship running and in firing at enemies.  You also have 1-3 allied ships (each with their own crews) on your team.What this means is that you want to be playing this game with friends.  Ideally get a 4-pack and give 3 copies to your friends and then play with all four of you as the crew of a ship.  If you don’t have any friends to play with, then make some in game.  Joining a clan will help you develop a group of people that you can play with and that you know you can rely on.  I’m not going to go into too many details about the gameplay, but the rough overview is that you have one pilot who moves the ship and communicates with allied pilots.  You also have three other crewmembers that fire guns and repair components on the ship.  There are different ships, gun loadouts, ammo types, tool loadouts, etc. to choose from.Cosmetics can be purchased, but provide no gameplay advantages.The playerbase is usually small (a couple hundred people online at most), although in the aftermath of sales it can be much greater.  You have a generally friendly community and active devs, who you will often find in matches as well.Yeah, that about sums it up.  Also, prepare to spend lots of time in lobbies.

Posted: May 16, 2014
												Lots of high flying steam punk fun.Pilot a battle blimp, fire the main cannons, or keep the tub in the air with your trusty rubber mallet, every role is important and each air ship requires a different strategy.There is no P2W that you might expect in a lobby based game, the only thing money will buy you is a bit of bling for your character or ship.Not to mention the Unity engine provides a wonderful environment with great visual effects and it is all topped off with a very fitting sound track.I do indeed recommend this game, just beware the Goldfish.

Posted: December 9, 2015
												Guns of Icarus is good! (for a more in depth review see below)Guns of Icarus is a game heavily focused on teamwork. If you are not a team player, this game is not for you. However if you are looking for a great team orientated game with lots of features (including three similar yet somewhat different classes, ship and character customization, detailed maps and more) then this game is definitely for you!The graphics, although not the best, are still fairly good and the art style is something I haven't seen done right in a while. The gameplay itself is amazing, with a crew consisting of a pilot and three other players which can be either engineers or gunners. The objective of the game is to destroy your opponents ships whilst keeping yours in the air (good luck in doing that if you have a pilot who drives like a toddler behind a toy wheel). This simple objective makes for some amazing moments where sometimes you find yourself ganging up on some of your closest friends (you may find yourself screaming at them because they failed to fix the balloon in time or steer away from the big pointy rock...).Overall I believe that Guns of Icarus is a great game with massive potential. The only downside is the lack of interest in the game nowadays. Sometimes you find that it's really difficult to find an open game in your region which can obviously be a negative since this game is strictly an online multiplayer only game.I rate 8/10 for Guns of Icarus

Posted: May 24, 2014
												Alright, so for my review.I am going to start with the visuals.So I am going to say that the ships themselves look really good. The textures for the walls, balloons, and guns and everything are really pretty nice. It has a very fun look to it. Sadly, look past the ship and be ready to see what apear to be giant mounds of fecal matter surrounded by gasios fog. The rocks, walls, buildings, and everything past your ship and other peoples ships look really lack luster, and it is really distracting from the otherwise nice apeal in of the ship.So now onto the actual gameplay.I am going to say this game is super fun to play. Like great fun. People over the voice chat are friendly and helpfull, the shooting mechanics are good, the controlls are snappy, it has a great mix of shooting, defense, and repairs and it is actually quite fun to jump around the airship fixing things and firing back at the enemy. While the in game transactions are a little anoying for a game that I payed for, they are mostly cosmetic and have little to no effect on the actual gameplay. The best in my opinion is the team death match, where you have two airships on your team and the equal amount on the other team, and you stratagise and team up to kill each other. It is great, and it can get really intense at some points. The best part of this game is when you get a group of friends on the same boat, and you can voice chat and stuff to comunicate enemy positions and directions. I have one gripe about the gameplay though.... And that is, a few of my friends on lower end rigs had some issues with clipping and some bad lag. This should not be the case with a meh looking game written in the unity engine.Difficulty: A lot of people in their reviews have pointed out that there can be a small learning curve when you first enter the game. I would agree with this, but I would also say that it is still fun when you are learning and it does not take long to get working like a well oilded machine.Overall, I would say this game is a load of fun if you can look past some poor textures and some poorly optimised gameplay. thesupergeek rates this a 12/10 for fun and a 8/10 for graphics. I will most likely play much more of this game over the summer.

Posted: October 27, 2014
												This game is so much fun to play. There are several classes you can play as; engi, gunner and pilot or captain class. Gunners are obviously responsible for shooting the enemies, destorying parts on their ships, and ultimately their goal is to kill them. There are many different guns and ammo types. Of course, for different gun different ammo is needed because it works in the gun better and is more effective at destorying the enemy. Typically your captain will suggest ammo but you may want to ask them what they want. OH, and always check the captains ship load out so you can see what guns are on there and if you already know what ammo works best equip it and double check with captain. Engis are like the glue of the whole airship, they are responsible for rebuilding parts on ship that have been destroyed, restoring health to damaged ship parts, and putting out fires, buffing equipment etc. The captain is the ships "brains", they steer the ship, use their captain tools to make the ship go faster, higher etc. Its loads of fun to play with your friends because it is an online mutliplayer you are always playing with people, making new friends. It also has clans that you can join and become part of their extended family and things. Its quite fun and i'd recommended any one buy it when it is onsale, seeing as its a good use of money and can be played for hours on end. I'd also recommend doing the tutorial b/c ppl get mad at new players often for just jumping on into games especially when they don't listen to load out recommendations or seem to know what they are doing on the ship. Plus doing the tutorial gives you a better understand of the classes and their specific roles on the ship.

Posted: December 22, 2013
												Not necessarily a game for everyone but I am personally a sucker for these sorts of teamwork games and have been wanting a game where you play as a single crewman on a ship as a multiplayer concept for a while. I was thinking tallship more then airship but no complaints here. The gameplay is simple but I find there is a good deal of strategic depth here with positioning, gun/ship matchups, and time management to keep things engaging. With a weak captain the game can feel pretty bland, but when you have a good talkative crew with plans and a leader suddenly you're playing a completely different game and it has a great feel to it. So far the community has had a really nice air to it and I've been having a ton of fun.On the downside bugs still crop up here and there. Nothing I haven't been able to fix by restarting the client but needing to do so mid match because I couldn't access my tools or use guns was frustrating. Hopefully that sort of thing will get patched up as the game moves forward.The game could end up feeling slow and for some classes you can find yourself behaving fairly mindlessly in your task which could result in finding things boring which is why I mentioned it may not be for everyone. I find that my investment in what is happening on the larger scope keeps me engaged even when I'm just staring out into a dustcloud waiting for the pilot to bring us around but that investment is largely created by the community and having a nice bunch in your crew. I've had some silent rides where I started to feel managing certain guns or covering certain areas as an engineer becoming monotonous. Though with a lively crew this never even occured to me.All in all, I've been having an absolute blast with it. If you like teamwork orientated games and feel you can be invested in a team outcome as much as personal activity you should have a great time here, though a mic is basically a must so do make sure you have one. If your unsure I would lean towards advising you give it a shot as it is a fairly unique sort of game. Even if you grow tired of it eventually I think you'll still find yourself with a good set of fond memories. Sometimes hunting for a good crew can take a bit but hop around and try to chat with people and see what you can find. If your having no luck try and find a Community Ambassador. They've all been great in my experience for getting fun matches rolling.

Posted: November 26, 2013
												For an indie game, this game is DEFINITELY WORTH the asking price! The game takes a bold direction by putting players in flying airships in a fancy steampunk- themed world. Teamwork is essential here, as you and three other players, each playing one of 3 different roles: Gunner, Engineer, and Pilot...must work together in order to ensure a decisive victory over your opponents in the skies! Gameplay is fun, addictive, and well- balanced (for the most part). A fresh change of pace from your typical team- based pvp game. It's just such a shame this game isn't more well- known....Highly recommend playing this game with a group of friends.

Posted: June 11, 2014
												This game is rather fun when you have a team that actually takes it seriously to a point where it doesn't involve death threats and calling names.  It has a very interesting style to it, which I enjoy.  The main key in this game, however, is how you use teamwork to crush the enemy team.  Only problem is, sometimes you would find the team that uses no communication or teamwork what so ever, and this eventually causes you terrible death and losing streak.   There aren't really a lot of people out in this game to provide such cooperation, but I've managed to find a few diamonds in the rough.  But as always, all games aren't perfect.Overall, it is a very nice and engaging game once you get the mechanics of it, which isn't too hard.  It's nice to steer away from all of the other first person shooters like Call of Duty and Battlefield, since this adds a new twist to it.  I would recommend trying to team up with your buddies and online friends if you really want to do any good.  Pros:-Addicting-Uses Cooperation and teamwork for key point-Isn't very hard (Once you get used to it, of course)-Great fun with friends-Very intense at timesCons:-Sometimes buggy-Hard to find many players that use the teamwork

Posted: September 14, 2015
												The feel and thrill you get when engaging in ship to ship combat and having to rely not only on your personal skills but on your own crew mates' as well is something you don't usually find in gaming.This is a game about cooperation and communication in a way that "realistic" war games fall short miles from.It is the most rewarding online experience I've had in years. Unique gameplay experience. Keeping me at the edge of my seat in a way I haven't seen in ages.Picture a stylish steampunk balloon under enemy fire: the Engineers are running around putting out fires and frantically fixing components, barely keeping up with the mounting damage; the Gunners are trying to return the damage they are taking with interest and maybe neutralize the enemies' guns and vital components to give themselves better odds before their own guns are taken out; the Captain is flying a ship with half the engines blown, the best gun out of commission and the balloon about to burst has to decide whether he can attempt to make a run for it or if it is better to bring all guns to bear and go down in a blaze of glory.

Posted: May 10, 2013
												YARRRR ME HEARTIESThis game is amazing and addictive... but what'd you expect from a steampunk-like airship combat simulator, tactically blowing your enemies to smithereens? The game's all about teamwork, enhancing and requiring a lot of contact between a ship's crew, which makes the game an amazing thing to play, and usually ends up being very socially cosy and enjoyable, and often gives you your daily healthy dose of rage. The community so far is great, too!An important point to bring forward to this game is that in order to play correctly and efficiently, you WILL need a microphone. The developers have alternatives such as voice commands, which helps, but for the most fluent and efficient communications, one should use microphone communications. The microphone recording/playback quality in-game are very fast and good enough to understand each other clearly.The game is well-populated and features an unique experience system through earning achievements. This encourages variety in your playstyle in order to discover what suits you and your crew most. Did I mention hats yet? Everybody likes hats. Especially if most of the cool hats and paint dyes are unlockable through gaining achievements anyway! Apart from the unavoidable bugs every now and then, the game's graphics are neatly done and the UI is very accessible and easy to get the hang of. The music is repetitive but cool, and the gameplay is astonishing. The 3 different classes give the player an opportunity to play as they like. Extremely roughly said: for constant focus on dodging and tactically positioning the ship, as well as laying traps and ramming into others without being able to maintain the ship itself, choose Pilot. For routine maintaining the ship under heavy pressure, repairing and rebuilding, as well as shooting every now and then, go Engineer. For pure shooting with special ammo and helping out with repairs every now and then, take Gunner. There's usually room on a ship for 1 Pilot, 2 Engineers and 1 Gunner. At least, that is most likely the most beneficial option.Once you go Guns of Icarus, ya can't stop, so get it now, I recommend it to everyone with a sense for action-packed fun, cooperation and enjoyment.

Posted: February 13, 2014
												Guns of Icarus Online is an absolutely spectacular game, certainly worth the price (especially if you and three friends all pool your money and get the 4-pack). Given that ship crews are four people strong (captain, engineer and two gunners in my group) this works out well.For an online-only game, and in absolute terms, the community is fantastic - never once have I encountered a rude player and novices actually get a chance to learn the game rather than be bullied out by the more-experienced players (looking at you, LoL).Feature-wise, the game is very dependant on teamwork, no single ship is overpowered and there are many different weapon loadouts for each given ship, making spotting and target identification a must-have skill. Each player can take five items of equipment (one sailing tool, one engineering tool, one gunnery tool; plus two extras for their chosen class), which allows for even more customisation in fighting style. The levelling system is strange but it works - achievements count towards levels, with so many achievements being needed to level up. Crucially for an online-only game, there is absolutely no pay-to-win.The game looks amazing, there's no doubt about that. Everything is beautifully rendered and designed. The soundtrack and in-game SFX are also incredible.The only downside I can think of is that if the game lags, it can have a severe impact on the entire crew's effectiveness, especially if the Captain is the one with the lag issues.

Posted: June 11, 2014
												This game is rather fun when you have a team that actually takes it seriously to a point where it doesn't involve death threats and calling names.  It has a very interesting style to it, which I enjoy.  The main key in this game, however, is how you use teamwork to crush the enemy team.  Only problem is, sometimes you would find the team that uses no communication or teamwork what so ever, and this eventually causes you terrible death and losing streak.   There aren't really a lot of people out in this game to provide such cooperation, but I've managed to find a few diamonds in the rough.  But as always, all games aren't perfect.Overall, it is a very nice and engaging game once you get the mechanics of it, which isn't too hard.  It's nice to steer away from all of the other first person shooters like Call of Duty and Battlefield, since this adds a new twist to it.  I would recommend trying to team up with your buddies and online friends if you really want to do any good. Posted: June 10, 2016
												I've wanted this game for a while now and I was finally able to purchase it with my friends when we found out the game was on sale last week.We instantly all fell in love with the game the moment we played it. We were immediately drawn to the game because of its gorgeous Steampunk art style, mostly because of the Steampunk themed Dungeons and Dragons campaign that I was taking part in with my friends. The game is gorgeous and creative when it comes to its design, and it fits the Steampunk style perfectly.The gameplay especially is very fun. Being able to fly your own airship across an area and fight other ships is satisfying, relaxing, and adventurous.The main reason why I wanted to write this review was not because of the 15k review milestone, but also to express how great the staff is. When I purchased the game, I immediately decided to purchase outfits for my characters. I soon discovered I made an accidental purchase and requested a refund. Never have I met such fast support before in a game. I was emailed very shortly after I sent my refund request and the staff kindly understood and gave me a quick refund with no real hassle at all.The game is great and the community itself in not only the players, but the staff as well.If you have any friends, get everyone you know to buy this game and command your own airship together.

Posted: November 25, 2013
												GoIO is quite the unique game, with a mostly fantastic community, and an always active and open Dev team. the game is deceptivly simple at first, but as you play you realise how deep and teamwork oriented everything is. i also love that the game caters to pretty much every possible play style in a ship to ship combat game, want to rush in and ram things to splinters? you can do it, want to run in, pop a ballon or set some fires and run away to safety? check, want to play it safe and snipe from across the map, you can do that too. you can even just launch a bunch of mines and try to trick the enemy into flying into them. anything and everything can be effective as long as you have good teamwork, and with a surprisingly civil community thats not a problem.

Posted: February 20, 2014
												Guns of Icarus Online has a wonderful teamwork aspect to it in which most other games don't really provide. Most games have a certain objective and then everyone can go off and do their own thing. With this game, you all have to work together and provide key communication in order to own the skies and take the victory.The game's graphics may not be as high as big brand games, but they sure are detailed enough to get the point across. The engine performs amazingly and I have had no trouble whatsoever in figuring out how to play. The controls are put up on screen (providing you kept the tips on) so that even the most novice of players can get a grip for the controls.Customization is also very big in this game. Not only can you customize your character's appearance, but you can customize your ship down to the last weapon. Want a flamethrower on your vessel? Go right ahead! The game already has a large selection of weapons for you to use so go ahead and use them!All in all this game is great and it really does show in the dynamic of its performance, quality, and playability. The easy controls, stunning design, and almost limitless customization makes this game perfect for those who seek action, and great team playing.

Posted: June 25, 2014
												This is one of the most lovingly well-crafted games I have ever seen. There is something about the way that the developers balance all of the components, from time-management, to customization, to sheer fighting force, that it creates an environment which fosters amazing teamwork and sportsmanship. In addition, it also makes for the nicest community of any game I've played.Graphics 9/10While the graphics aren't quite as photo-realistic as some of the big name games out there (CoD, Halo, etc…) they are beautifully crafted, and present a rough and rugged steampunk setting. The ships themselves are detailed and full of moving parts, which serve as a reminder that you aren't on just some video-game ship, but a real piece of machinery. The landscapes, too, are stunning, and though up close, the textures are slightly lacking, when you are mid air, it makes for some amazing vistas. The combination of sublime natural beauty and post-apocalyptic destruction is successful. In particular, I am fond of the WWII era battleship half-sunk in the sand of Battle on the Dunes, and the wreckage of an airship skeleton on Duel at Dawn.Story 8/10 (tentative)Well, since there isn't a real storyline as of yet, this rating is a little based on potential I see, but from the meta-game material I've seen, the introductions shown on each map, and the imminent advent of adventure mode, I am very excited for how the story will develop. From the hints, though, things are looking pretty cool.Music 8/10The music in this game is well-crafted, if not quite as creative or actual-music-y as the soundtrack of Bastion, per se, but what they do have, is a soundtrack that modulates based on play. When you spawn, there is no music, but as you near other ships, ominous drums begin to play, followed by flutes playing war cries, then more and more of the orchestra come in as the battle intensifies. This lends a great tension to the game, and makes for a very satisfying battle experience.Gameplay 10/10There is nothing that I can really fault the gameplay for at large. Sometimes glitches creep in, but the devs are very good about fixing them. In terms of genre, it's hard to say where to place this. It really depends on your class. There are three classes: The Pilot, The Engineer, and The Gunner. When you are playing with the pilot, the game plays like a dogfighter, only a little slower, since you're flying a ship rather than a plane (Though planes are in the works, apparently). This is not to say that it is boring. On the contrary, the 3D movement is very fluid, and competent captains can pull off some pretty amazing moves. Also, there are a variety of piloting tools to allow your ship to perform better. As engineer, you are playing a time management game, combined with a bit of fps, and a bit of parkour. You have to keep all the components repaired, but also might need to do daring jumps around the ship to get to them fast enough. Instead of boring time-management, though, there is always a great deal of excitement as the engineer, since the tension of the battle spices things up, and you need to negotiate with your crew. As Gunner, you're playing a turret-based fps, with some time management. The guns are very satisfying, and aiming is a good challenge, especially with arcing mortars or sniper rifles. However, where this game really shines is the crew and team cooperation. The captain commands his crew, but the crew also has to negotiate themselves and make sure that the ship is in tip-top shape (and the enemies aren't). Quite often, there is a quick friendship formed between the crew and captain, and a banter on the ship is not uncommon. Furthermore, there is another layer of teamwork as the captain must team up with the other ships on his team. The voice chat is very smooth, and it is highly recommended, since communication is critical.Community 10/10The learning curve on this game is a little steep, but luckily (unless you fail to communicate at all), you will be helped out by higher level players. Most level 15's are happy to play with level 1's and will give them commands to help them learn. It's very rare that you meet a troll, and the community usually snuffs them out with the power of friendship and love. The lobbies are usually lively, and conversations between games are usually off-topic and fun. However, people who want to play seriously will do so, but still with a sense of fun. Furthermore, there are frequent tournaments and player hosted events like ship racing. One of the best parts, however, is the dev involvement. There are devs on almost every day, and most players have a chance to play with them. When you send an email, they respond within hours, usually, and will not hesitate to post in every steam discussion. Balance 10/10This game is not pay-to-win, which is awesome. You can buy things, but they are only cosmetic, and very cheap, so nobody is ever ahead by money. Better still, when you level, you don't unlock new weapons, which would give high level players an even higher advantage. You do unlock cool costumes, and badges, though, which is more than fair compensation. All of the ships are equal, and nothing is really OP in the game, so really, the team with the best strategy and teamwork wins, not the higher level players with more money.Overall 10/10The reviews gave this game a bad rep, because of its glitchiness in the beta. DO NOT BELIEVE METACRITIC. Those are early reviews of and early version. If the reviews reflected the current version, they would be far higher. Honestly, I think this is a game for everybody. Get it while it's on sale if you can, but it's well worth the $15. It's definitely better with friends, though, so if you can, get a 4-pack and play with your friends as crew. There is no reason for this not to be the top team-based game in the world. Buy it now, and make the awesome community even awesomer.

content:
Posted: June 10, 2016
												I've wanted this game for a while now and I was finally able to purchase it with my friends when we found out the game was on sale last week.We instantly all fell in love with the game the moment we played it. We were immediately drawn to the game because of its gorgeous Steampunk art style, mostly because of the Steampunk themed Dungeons and Dragons campaign that I was taking part in with my friends. The game is gorgeous and creative when it comes to its design, and it fits the Steampunk style perfectly.The gameplay especially is very fun. Being able to fly your own airship across an area and fight other ships is satisfying, relaxing, and adventurous.The main reason why I wanted to write this review was not because of the 15k review milestone, but also to express how great the staff is. When I purchased the game, I immediately decided to purchase outfits for my characters. I soon discovered I made an accidental purchase and requested a refund. Never have I met such fast support before in a game. I was emailed very shortly after I sent my refund request and the staff kindly understood and gave me a quick refund with no real hassle at all.The game is great and the community itself in not only the players, but the staff as well.If you have any friends, get everyone you know to buy this game and command your own airship together.

Posted: November 25, 2013
												GoIO is quite the unique game, with a mostly fantastic community, and an always active and open Dev team. the game is deceptivly simple at first, but as you play you realise how deep and teamwork oriented everything is. i also love that the game caters to pretty much every possible play style in a ship to ship combat game, want to rush in and ram things to splinters? you can do it, want to run in, pop a ballon or set some fires and run away to safety? check, want to play it safe and snipe from across the map, you can do that too. you can even just launch a bunch of mines and try to trick the enemy into flying into them. anything and everything can be effective as long as you have good teamwork, and with a surprisingly civil community thats not a problem.

												At the time of writing I have enjoyed my first 12 hours of the game. To give a bit of background, I prefer to play with friends rather than on my own or with random strangers in any game.Get one or two friends together and your sure to have a good time. You don't have to be able to shoot straight (unless you're a gunner) and you don't have to be an able pilot (unless you're playing pilot) thanks to the engineer class who is in charge of keeping the ship together, putting out and preventing fires, and buffing the weapons and engines to give an edge to the battle.AI crewmen are second rate compared to human players and I recommend that you get as many people together as possible before starting the match; this is where the game shows its negative side, it can take ages to get a match going as the smallest matches require 4 ships with at least 1 human captain each.The community has been nice thus far, aside from the odd♥♥♥♥♥♥measuring flame war, most players you meet are either dead silent or pleasant to talk with. The game comes with a wide variety of airships for different play styles, all of which are unlocked from the beginning (unless you are playing in "novice matches"). Each ship can be equiped your own custom load out of guns, it is highly recommended that you (as designer) listen to your gunners request for which guns they want on it, otherwise you may alienate them.

Posted: May 10, 2013
												YARRRR ME HEARTIESThis game is amazing and addictive... but what'd you expect from a steampunk-like airship combat simulator, tactically blowing your enemies to smithereens? The game's all about teamwork, enhancing and requiring a lot of contact between a ship's crew, which makes the game an amazing thing to play, and usually ends up being very socially cosy and enjoyable, and often gives you your daily healthy dose of rage. The community so far is great, too!An important point to bring forward to this game is that in order to play correctly and efficiently, you WILL need a microphone. The developers have alternatives such as voice commands, which helps, but for the most fluent and efficient communications, one should use microphone communications. The microphone recording/playback quality in-game are very fast and good enough to understand each other clearly.The game is well-populated and features an unique experience system through earning achievements. This encourages variety in your playstyle in order to discover what suits you and your crew most. Did I mention hats yet? Everybody likes hats. Especially if most of the cool hats and paint dyes are unlockable through gaining achievements anyway! Apart from the unavoidable bugs every now and then, the game's graphics are neatly done and the UI is very accessible and easy to get the hang of. The music is repetitive but cool, and the gameplay is astonishing. The 3 different classes give the player an opportunity to play as they like. Extremely roughly said: for constant focus on dodging and tactically positioning the ship, as well as laying traps and ramming into others without being able to maintain the ship itself, choose Pilot. For routine maintaining the ship under heavy pressure, repairing and rebuilding, as well as shooting every now and then, go Engineer. For pure shooting with special ammo and helping out with repairs every now and then, take Gunner. There's usually room on a ship for 1 Pilot, 2 Engineers and 1 Gunner. At least, that is most likely the most beneficial option.Once you go Guns of Icarus, ya can't stop, so get it now, I recommend it to everyone with a sense for action-packed fun, cooperation and enjoyment.

Posted: October 27, 2012
												Guns of Icarus Online - Now there's a unique, little game. Set in a steampunky universe, you and three friends/randoms/AIs man a heavily armed airship through treacherous cliffsides or dusty dunes and engage the enemies 1-4 ships at range or in tight dogfights. The arsenal of weapons is decent, with new ones added through patches. A few different ships allow you to play the game like you want it - as a fast, harassing mosquito or as a well-armed and armoured battleship. As with weapons, new ships have been announced and will probably be added eventually. As far as customisation goes, currently you can only modify the character you play as, give him/her a nice outfit, a hat and accessories. According to the devs there will even be a sort-of open world aspect in the near future, allowing you to play as a merchant, pirate or mercenary. Even now, though, the game is definitely worth checking out if you want something that stands out. Heaps of fun with some buddies!

												This game is good.The community I believe, is the best part of it; almost all the players are friendly and welcoming. Out of the hundreds of matches I've been in I've only experienced one rather unpleasant individual. The gameplay is incredibly fun, there is a depth to the countless strategies and ways to play the game that are really great. Ship customization allows you to make really interesting builds, you can have a fast sniping ship or a tanky ship with heavy guns. This is one of the few games I always come back to play, it's totally worth it!Pros:+ Fun, intense gameplay+ Incredibly friendly community+ Countless ways to play and strategize+ Great visuals+ Constant new updates + Lots of fun with friendsCons:+ At times can get repetitive+ The matchmaking lobbies drag on forever. Posted: November 26, 2013
												For an indie game, this game is DEFINITELY WORTH the asking price! The game takes a bold direction by putting players in flying airships in a fancy steampunk- themed world. Teamwork is essential here, as you and three other players, each playing one of 3 different roles: Gunner, Engineer, and Pilot...must work together in order to ensure a decisive victory over your opponents in the skies! Gameplay is fun, addictive, and well- balanced (for the most part). A fresh change of pace from your typical team- based pvp game. It's just such a shame this game isn't more well- known....Highly recommend playing this game with a group of friends.

Posted: November 30, 2013
												Please, if you're even slightly interested in this game, stick with me to the end.At first, I was turned off of this game. The in-game cosmetic microtransactions in a paid game, and a couple of friends' opinions of it did not sell it for me. But, when another friend of mine gave me the game so that I could crew on his ships, and I gave it another look...I found my new favorite game.The developers have put in a lot of time, effort, and love into their creation and their community. They're quite involved with the people that play their game, and many if not all of them play their game every chance they get, twice a week.The in-game cosmetic store, let me say, is optional. Nothing you buy will affect your gameplay...AND, any piece in the store can be earned for free in dev matches, hosted Tuesdays and Thursdays, if you're feeling particularly frugal.About the game itself, think of it as "3D naval battles" against other teams of people. Each crew of four works together to man a ship, which is chosen by the captain. Each ship flies differently, and uses different tactics and strategies to be effective. The most important aspects to winning this game are, in my opinion, communication, morale, and teamwork, in that order. Everything else is gravy.Guns of Icarus: Online is seriously underrated, and I hope that everyone gives it a chance. But I must say, it's even better if you have someone to fly with. Bring a friend or two, and you won't regret it!

Posted: October 25, 2015
												Guns of Icarus has a very unique concept. And the execution is nearly perfectlyYou got 4 guys per ship doing different things. (Usually 1 Pilot, 2 People using the Guns and 1 person focused on repairing.) The Persons themself are unkilable, only the ship is.There are 3 Game Modes: Team Deathmatch, King of the Hill and Crazy King.Then there are 3 classes to choose from. Each of em has it´s own purpose with it´s own tools.But the by far most important and most positive aspect of this Game is the community!!!This community is the direct opposite to CoD or CS:GO.It is really small with only around 400 (getting up to 6000 players during sales)  people at a time, but thats a good thing and this Game is definitely NOT DEAD.You start recognizing people, make friends really quickly and learn the baiscs and advanced stuff pretty fast.U can customize a lot of stuff in this game. Your look (cosmetics available through microtransactions, but no benefitial stuff), Your Ship, the Guns u have on it, what ammo u wanna use for em, you can pick stuff like kerosine to fly faster or a chute vent to decrease altitude really quickly as a pilot.This game is really atmospheric aswell. You got all sorts of Maps from dunes to ruined cities to snowy mountains and a frozen ocean. The music is awesome and really fitting.The combat is good aswell. You have different guns all made for different parts of the ship. U have a Gatling Gun t shred through the opponents armor, Flamethrowers to light things up, Carronades to destroy a ship´s Balloon. Or heavy guns like Flaks and Hwachas. Destroying a certain part of the ship has a certain effect. If your engines are destroyed you will have a hard time moving, if the Balloon is down you will descent until you hit the ground and die eventually.All of that stuff can be repaired again though.It is not everybodys Game though. Everybody cares his package and has his job. If you dont do it correctly chances are your ship wont get a single kill. The Engineers have to react quickly on broken parts, the Gunners should be percise and the Pilot should´nt hit every mountain on the map. Communication is key. If you see a ship, call it. If a part is destroyed, call it. If u need the guns armed at the port or starboard side, call it.A bad thing could be that because of the close-knitted community and the age of this game, there aren´t any Lobbies for new players. Before you reach level 8 with any class you will be able to play in so called novice matches. But there aren´t any so expect to get torn apart at your first game. But I would be suprised if your crew would be mad at you. Usually they are nice folks who will stay friendly and teach you a couple of things like what equipment is better or what ammo you should use for what gun.Another really awesome thing is the touch between the community and the developers. They join public matches, do Streams to talk to the players and even support events from bigger clans like the weekly Iron Fork from the Cake Clanon Fridays. They also do dev games where you can play against them and if you win you will get an Item for free.They are still actively supporting the game with patches, fixes and even an upcoming coop story mode, which sounds like it will have some unique concepts.Some people say that they quitted GoI because of a patch released some time ago. I bought this game after said patch and cannot make a statement about if it became worse or not. All I can say is that this Game is probably one of the best coop games out there and that you are missing out something if you dont give this game at least a shot.If I had to rate it I would give it a 9/10, probably a 10/10 as soon as the coop mode comes out. This game can be confusing for beginners, but as long as you communicate and you are willing to learn there should be nothing that can stop you and your crew from conquering the skies.
